Name: Business Analyst
Description: At Scotts Miracle-Gro we think people are like plants....in the right place you will grow and flourish. Are you an advocate of making the world a more beautiful place by inspiring others, championing new ideas and being intellectually curious? Are you not afraid to roll up your sleeves and get your hands dirty? If so, then we want you as part of our Scotts family...the world's largest marketer of branded consumer lawn and garden care products!  We are looking for a Business Analyst who will join our Business Transformation (IT) team.  This position will be based at The Scotts Miracle-Gro world headquarters in Marysville, a suburb of Columbus, OH. Not familiar with Columbus? Visit columbusregion.com/columbus-2020/  Scotts Miracle-Gro established the Business Transformation (BT) group to work with the business to develop plans to align technology and process resources with the business strategy. These plans include continuing efforts to support our base business in leveraging existing technologies and solutions to realize continuous improvements, improve the productivity of our global workforce, address the need for more effective and efficient communication of information, and support for the evolving business model to grow with our "Consumer First" strategy.  This position contributes to the success of the BT group through the governance of communications and organizational change management within the department, as well as governance of project methodology, improvement and management of key processes.  In this role you will: Communications and Organizational Change ManagementDrive communication and organizational change management efforts for BT.Portfolio Planning and Project GovernanceLead and/or consult on communication and organizational change management activities for specific projects/initiatives (e.g., as a formal member of a project team).BT Process Management & ImprovementLead the communication processes and quality of the content of information and distribution of the departmental weekly status report.Service Desk ManagementProvide leadership oversight for our Outsourced Service Desk team. Serve as the primary liaison between BT and our Outsource provider. The perfect person will have: Minimum of 5 years of communications experience - IT experience a plus.Minimum of 3 years of organizational change management experience - IT experience a plus.Portfolio Planning - experience defining and prioritizing multi-year plans that align with business strategy.Business Process Transformation - minimum 3 years experience in business process design and improvement which includes success in designing sustainable business processes to drive expected business results.Conceptual and/or practical knowledge and experience of using information technologies (e.g. SAP) to support business processes.Strong verbal and written communication skills, with an ability to effectively express complex concepts in simple business terms across all levels of the organization.Strong analytical, problem-solving, and conceptual skills.Ability to think strategically and plan effectively.Conceptual and/or demonstrated project management knowledge and experience.Financial management skills including proven competency in business case development.Proven business process design and improvement skills including experience using structured process improvement methods.Ability to influence and gain alignment with people at all levels in the organization, on the approach and timing to implement solutions to strategic business problems.Strong perseverance abilities in the face of challenges and an ability to deal with conflicts constructively.Ability to partner with peers, team members and demonstrate collaborative, effective teamwork.Comfort and flexibility with changing priorities, high levels of ambiguity, and non-routine issues.Ability to multi-task in fast-paced deadline intensive environment.Ability to anticipate obstacles and plan contingencies.Core competencies: Problem Solving & Analysis. Business Acumen. Communication & Leadership. Relationship Building. Creativity & Innovation. Influence and Organizational Savvy. Planning & Organizing. What we do for our associates (just to list a few cool ones): Offer extremely competitive benefits including: Health, Dental and Vision coverage.Onsite wellness center which includes: 2,400 sq. ft. fitness center, Walgreens pharmacy and Doctor’s office.Beautiful campus and corporate offices designed like a log cabin offering free coffee, chef run cafe and the best crushed ice!Unbelievable 401K match and discounted stock purchasing program.Our commitment to diversity and inclusion includes four employee resource groups: Scotts Women’s Network, Scotts Black Employee Network, Scotts Veterans Network and Scotts Young Professionals.Generous vacation day policy.Various associate engagement activities throughout the year including intramural sports leagues. COME GROW WITH US, WHERE THE GRASS REALLY IS GREENER!  Not interested in this role? Check out our other career opportunities and learn more about what it’s like to work at Scotts Miracle-Gro by accessing our Talent Network: SMG Talent Network  The Scotts Miracle-Gro Company (NYSE: SMG) is the world's largest marketer of branded consumer lawn and garden products, with a full range of products for professional horticulture as well. Scotts Miracle-Gro has helped to grow the nearly $7 billion global consumer lawn and garden market through product innovation, industry-leading advertising efforts and its trusted brands.  The brands and products within our portfolio include: Scotts, Miracle-Gro, TomCat, Ortho, RoundUp, Bonnie Plants, Osmocote, Earthgro and Fafard.  Scotts is an EEO Employer, dedicated to a culturally diverse, drug free workplace.  EEO/AA Employer/Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity Notification to Agencies: Please note that the Scotts Miracle-Gro company does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Master Service Agreement, and specific approval to submit resumes to an approved requisition, the Scotts Miracle-Gro company will not consider or approve payment regarding recruiter fees or referral compensations.

Name: Diversity Business Analyst- Diversity Business Analyst Senior
Description: TitleDiversity Business Analyst- Diversity Business Analyst Senior28-Nov-2018Job DescriptionThis position is posted in a range from Diversity Business Analyst to an Diversity Business Analyst Senior. *Note: Education and/or experience will be used to determine the appropriate salary and salary grade level. Position SummaryAs an integral part of the Diversity & Inclusion team, the Diversity Business Analyst will be responsible for conducting statistical analysis including descriptive and predictive modeling to advance diversity strategic objectives. The Analyst will also be responsible for developing, monitoring, & disseminating EEO, affirmative action, & other federal/state legally mandated analyses/reports. This role plays a key part in analyzing and summarizing data to tell a story regarding the current and future state of workforce demographics.Principle AccountabilitiesCreate and maintain enterprise/business unit Diversity & Inclusion scorecards, dashboards, heat maps, and interactive reports to identify trends, root cause and actionable insights.Develop visualizations that properly convey insights derived from data analyses.Interpret and present analytical data to executives and other key stakeholders.Develop, maintain, and analyze spreadsheets and databases extracting current and historical workforce data from multiple systems.Use workforce demographic data to investigate potential correlation between hiring, promotion and other decisions and the advancement of diversity program objectives. Retrieve, compile, analyze, and visualize data for legally required AA/EO reports in accordance with federal/state compliance regulations; compile/complete annual VETS 4212 report in compliance with related requirements.Conduct adverse impact analyses and other statistical analyses for annual Affirmative Action plans; develop methodology and provide data reports to periodically monitor progress toward goals & analyze/identify trends.Conduct pay equity study to identify potential risks.Develop key performance indicators and metrics to measure the effectiveness of diversity and inclusion initiatives, i.e., education and awareness; Employee Resource Groups; etc.Oversee the completion of diversity related benchmark surveys, i.e., Human Rights Campaign, Disability Equality Index, etc.Prepare standard and ad-hoc reports to monitor trends in hiring, promotion, performance ratings, termination, etc.Auto req ID19769BRRelocationNo LocationColumbus, OH Job TypeFull-Time Job CategoryHuman Resources/Recruiting/Training Minimum RequirementsWorkforce Diversity Data Analyst:Education  :Bachelor’s degree Experience: Minimum of 3 years in Business Analytics or Human Resources related function. Minimum of 3 years conducting complex statistical analysis, projections, and trends. Working with business intelligence solutions, delivering metrics, dashboards, etc. Workforce Diversity Data Analyst Senior:Education  :Bachelor’s degree Experience: Minimum of 6 years in Business Analytics or Human Resources related function. Minimum of 6 years conducting complex statistical analysis, projections, and trends. Working with business intelligence solutions, delivering metrics, dashboards, etc. Requirements- Other / Preferred Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree Statistics, Math, Human Resources or related field.Minimum of 3-6 years in Diversity, Inclusion, Equity, Compliance or related function.Experience with various Human Capitol systems, i.e., PeopleSoft, Kenexa, Oracle, etc.Delivering innovative solutions in support of Diversity and Inclusion strategies.Knowledge and SkillsExcellent written and verbal communication skills.Demonstrated project management skills.Ability to translate advanced data analysis techniques into common concepts.Excellent facilitation and presentation skills.Demonstrated conceptual & critical thinking skills.Ability to develop research questions and research design.Proficiency in statistical software (R, Python, SAS) and MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint).Proficiency with a visualization tool (Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI)

Name: Business Analyst, Lead
Description: Job Description:This position is responsible for identifying, defining, planning, coordinating, and executing requirements of information systems of various size and complexity. Under general direction, leads project scoping and helps mature agile practices on multiple projects concurrently. As an experienced agile and SDLC professional, the ideal candidate will help define and continuously improve project initiation and the requirements discipline. Is expected to troubleshoot existing system logic difficulties and documentation as necessary. Should have experience and ability to support, large, complex, cross organizational projects and programs from inception through operations. Strong in building relationships with key stakeholders including senior business and IT leadership. Will be responsible for leading and mentoring junior team members and is expected to operate in both a team and individual environment. Standards - Expected to develop and maintain standards, tools, techniques and processes applicable to the analysis and documentation required of the business analyst group. This would include contributing to application/solution development lifecycle process improvements as well as processes and documentation. Advocates and implements agile maturity standards across the board Business Process Analysis -- Ability to identify businesses strengths and weaknesses and suggests areas of improvement. Understand and recommend modifications to business processes addressing complex business issues as the business and systems evolve. Coaching - Will mentor and coach team members. Required to review and provide feedback on specifications, requirements and process flows. Travel & Work Hours - Occasional travel (domestic or international) between operating companies may be required. Work during nonstandard hours may be required.  30%: Process Management - Assists in defining SDLC processes, metrics, agile best practices, standard work, project scope, project plans, dependency matrix, and issue resolution with the management team. Guides the technology team and other business analysts regarding implementation and documentation of projects, processes, methodologies and engineering techniques. Provides leadership and management including delegation, mentoring, and coaching. Identify risks and mitigation strategies  20%: Continuous Improvement - Measures the effectiveness and seeks to continually improve the quality of processes. Includes processes, practices and standards to be implemented in the business analyst community. Lead the center of excellence and implement ideas and solutions to improve effectiveness and efficiency.  20%: Strategist - Develop long-term strategies for improved operational processes and system functionality.  20%: Analyst - Performs and manages project scoping. Consistently demonstrate thorough understanding of high-level business processes. Identify and present opportunities, alternatives and recommendations to business and IT leadership.  10%: Relationship building - Acts as an ambassador and liaison for Technology Services. Develops relationships with customers by being proactive, displaying a high-level of knowledge of the business and providing innovative business solutions. Must be able to drive prioritization conversations and negotiations with the business partners and solution providersRequirements:Education Level: Bachelor's Degree. Masters preferred. Course of Study/Major: Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or other Technology-related fields such as Aviation Related Work Experience: 10+ years Requirements:Demonstrated mastery of software development lifecycle management including formal requirements and analysis methodologies documentation techniques such as use cases, business rules, impact analysis, process diagrams, etc.Requires ability to establish standards and guidelines for analytical processes and documentation from development through adoption.Expert analytical and problem-solving skills. Must be able to identify the best solution leveraging custom applications and Platform Solutions (Example: SAP, SalesForce, etc) that are cost effectiveRequires ability to understand existing business processes and suggest improvements where necessaryRequires ability to multi-task across multiple large, cross-departmental, complex projects and/or initiatives understanding priority and competing needs with minimal direction from management.Requires excellent verbal and written communication skills, people skills, negotiation, coordination, planning, presentation skills, facilitation skillsRequires a demonstrated success in navigating a complex organizational structure.Seven or more years of experience in scoping, analysis and requirements gathering for large, complex software projects.Demonstrated ability in metrics driven continuous improvement initiativesExperienced in facilitating meaningful conversations with business and IT stakeholders, and can build consensusSkilled in coaching and mentoring team members.Experience in Use Case analysis and modeling, and other industry best practices.Drive SDLC and agile maturity within the organizationExperience in effectively partnering and negotiating with vendors and solution providers

Name: Business Analyst
Description: **Named a top workplace 5 years in a row in Central Ohio by Columbus CEO magazine** Business AnalystWho is HMB? HMB is a professional services firm that has been in business for 24 years in Columbus, OH. We have helped hundreds of companies achieve their goals by using reliable, newer, and scalable technologies to implement effective applications that support and complement their core business functions. HMB is committed to training and career growth, and on a daily basis teams collaborate to deliver top notch project solutions that clients are grateful for. Most of all we have fun, work together as a team, and balance our work with life! What is the position? This is a hands-on consulting delivery role. You'll work with the customer to define their requirements and then you'll lead the system requirements gathering process. This person provides hands-on operational and technical skills to support the project mission, understands business challenges & translates them into client-focused solutions throughout the project lifecycle. This individual provides hands-on leadership and direction to the team as well as manages client relationships. Therefore, the ideal candidate must be able to successfully communicate with business stakeholders and build good working rapports with all project team members. This person will also be involved in business case development and performance measurement. Desired Skills & Experience:Experience gathering data and establishing a business case in order to influence areas in need of improvementAnalyzes, tests and documents complex enhancements made to new and/or existing programs.Functions as the liaison between the business line, operations, and the technical areas throughout the project cycleExcellent organizational, planning, problem solving and decision making skills including experience with project management methodologies required.Experience in writing test cases, uses cases and writing functional and technical requirement documentsExposure to Agile or other project management methodologies as well as working through the SDLC preferred2+ years of Business Analysis work preferredProfessional Competencies:Creative and independent thinking skills to solve problems quicklyOptimistic, passionate, idea generatorInquisitive, love of the unknownAnalytic, organized and detail orientedWhats included in the full-time, salaried position?Competitive Compensation PackagesPaid Comp TimeEmployee Subsidized Medical PremiumsAnnual Bonus ProgramsPaid Time Off401K + matchHardware and Software ReimbursementPaid Training and learning programs through our HMB UniversityTuition ReimbursementWellness ProgramEmployee social outings and events year-round!For more information on HMB, please visit our website at www.hmbnet.com or send your resume to recruiting@hmbnet.com. We would love to chat with you! **If you know someone who may be a good fit, we offer an external referral bonus! Refer someone and you could qualify for a $500 Amazon Gift Card!

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Responsibilities Performs a variety of complex tasks, such as designing and documenting business process and systems logic.  Provides technical training, guidance, and resource support for end users and departmental staff.  Defines system requirements, priorities, and viable alternatives.  Coordinates the efforts of business and IT teams to locate, assess, install, test, and maintain computer software systems.  Drives systems analysis and design as part of the software development life cycle (SDLC).  Coordinates conversions and upgrades to vendor systems.  Performs as a project lead and directs other systems analysts or application developers.  Assists in developing user documentation and departmental policies and procedures.Proactively performs process and systems analysis and makes recommendations for improvement that positively impact overall cost, efficiency, or quality. Qualifications Bachelor's degree required. Masters degree preferred.  5+ years experience in systems analysis and/or software development life cycle, including project management or leadership responsibilities required.  Ability to exercise independent judgment in planning, organizing, and performing systems analyst tasks.  Must have ability to communicate and organize projects frequently under deadline pressure.

Description: Title : Business Analyst  Location : Reynoldsburg, OH  Duration : 6+ Months Contract Experience:Bachelors DegreeAdvanced SAS and SQL skills - 5+ years of experienceQualifications/ Skills:Understanding of Relational DatabasesExperience in analytical tools and techniquesSQL and SAS ProficientStrong skills in reporting tools (i.e. Cognos, Crystal, MicroStrategy, Business Objects)Strong Communication SkillsPrevious retail or direct marketing experience a plusResponsibilities:Scope and modify/develop data extracts, analysis code and reporting codeProvide testing supportSupport and modification of complex SQL and SAS queriesAssist analytics and data teams to query, summarize and interpret the customer purchase history, demographics

Name: Analyst
Description: Who we areKlarnas mission is to free people from all the meaningless time spent managing money and purchases, so they can do more of what they love. Every day at Klarna we help consumers, merchants, and partners to explore just how smoooth the modern purchase experience can be. Our position at the crossroads of payments, consumer financing, ecommerce and banking means we are uniquely positioned to do this. There is no label for what we do. Klarna was born in Stockholm in 2005 and today has 2000 employees working across Europe and the US. We currently serve 60 million consumers, work together with 90,000 merchants and process more than a million payment transactions a day. We are growing at 40% year on year and our investors include Visa, Atomico, Sequoia Capital, Permira and Bestseller group/ Anders Holsch Povlsen. We have strong partnerships with some of the worlds leading brands, such as ASOS, IKEA, Adidas, Zara, Lufthansa and Spotify. To find out more about what it's like to work at Klarna: https://www.klarna.com/careers/What.Analytics at Klarna is divided into many teams, all with their own unique responsibilities. However, there are some commonalities - they consist of highly driven people with a combination of analytical skills and a great team spirit. In general, some things you would potentially be doing:Designing and implementing strategies in a rapidly evolving industry.Pro-actively and effectively communicating with various stakeholders, discussing the root cause of trends, assessing their impact and proposing solutions/optimizations.Supporting wider business objectives by providing analytical expertise on new products and system developments and collaborating closely with other teams where relevant.Delivering ad-hoc data analysis to support risk mitigation and control environment.Developing as a professional in an entrepreneurial organization that provides opportunity to work with your areas of interest.Using analytical tools (e.g. SQL, Excel, R) to analyze data and problem solve with the end goal of detecting trends and making decisions.You.Klarna is looking for ambitious people with significant drive. You should be passionate about your job and enjoy a fast paced international working environment. Since you will play an important role in taking Klarna to the next level, you should desire to go above and beyond to produce the best work results. At Klarna we embrace change; you should dare to challenge the status quo and be persistent.Required.A degree from a university in a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics) or a Business field.Applicable work experience.Working proficiency and communication skills in verbal and written English.Authorization to work in the United States.Significant drive and ambition.Strong conceptual ability.Preferred.Strong attention to detail and experience in using structured approaches to problem solving.An understanding for how to perform data extraction and manipulation, as well as programming languages is a plus (SQL, R, Python, MatLab, Java, C# etc.).We can offer you an international working environment filled with smart and ambitious colleagues. We know that diverse teams are strong teams, so we welcome those from different backgrounds and experiences. As part of one of Europes fastest growing companies, you'll help play an important role in taking Klarna to the next level.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Working at ICFWorking at ICF means applying a passion for meaningful work with intellectual rigor to help solve the leading issues of our day. Smart, compassionate, innovative, committed, ICF employees tackle unprecedented challenges to benefit people, businesses, and governments around the globe. We believe in collaboration, mutual respect, open communication, and opportunity for growth. If you’re seeking to make a difference in the world, visit www.icf.com/careers to find your next career. ICF—together for tomorrow.Who we are: Audacious. Ingenious. Real. If that sounds like you, you’ll fit right in. Olson Digital is a new breed of agency, purpose-built for marketing’s new realities. Olson Digital's full-service solutions crack complex challenges. Digital has completely transformed the customer experience, and consumers are connected in ways we’ve never seen—ways that challenge marketers and IT alike. Whether it's helping you speak to your customers, providing a richer digital experience, or deploying platforms that deliver results, we have you covered. Overview: ICF Olson has an exciting opportunity for an experienced Business Analyst responsible for providing analysis for strategic, complex initiatives in support of multiple lines of businesses throughout Olson Digital. This role requires an individual to be able to think \"out-of-box\" in client solution development and work collaboratively with clients to conduct stakeholder interviews, identify business process impacts, and elicit business & functional requirements Role DescriptionPerform requirements gathering through interviews, document and artifact analysis, facilitated workshop sessions, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, user stories, scenarios, business analysis, task and workflow analysisBring strong analytical skills to bear on projects, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret client business needs and translate them into detailed user stories & functional specificationsDrive and challenge business stakeholders on requirements, processes, and solution drivers to ensure an appropriate level of detail and to remove ambiguityCommunicate and collaborate proactively with external and internal clients to analyze information and functional needs and deliver functional requirements, business requirements, and user storiesCollaborate with Creative team and ensure that User Experience and Visual Design align with required functionalityProvide support to Technical and QA teams to provide guidance and clarifications regarding requirement questionsGain thorough understanding of client and business needs in order to provide consultative insights and fill role of business partnerSkills and KnowledgeBS or 3-5 years’ experience in documenting requirementsExperience working in the digital agency or consulting firm spaceWillingness to travel as required for client engagementsExcellent presentation and communications skills that establish trust, credibility and respectFamiliarity with and aptitude to understand ecommerce, CRM, and CMS platforms supported by Olson Digital, such as Hybris, Sitecore, Marketo, Adobe AEM, Salesforce, or similarExperience with the Atlassian Suite (Jira, Confluence)Excellent attention to detail with a strong understanding of businessAbility to manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced, self-motivated, and self-managed environmentExperience with Adobe Analytics or similar analytics program is highly desirableExperience working with highly distributed and offshore teamsFamiliarity with different development methodologies including Agile, Iterative and Waterfall ICF Olson is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity at all levels. (EOE – Minorities/Females/ Protected Veterans Status/Disability Status/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity)Fairfax, VA (VA01)

Name: Business Analyst
Description: At Updox, a Business Analyst is responsible for working with customers (internal and external) to develop solutions to challenging business problems and opportunities. The Business Analyst works with the customer to fully flesh out ideas, helping them to understand key business integration points as well as any tradeoffs that may exist. The Business Analyst works to translate the customers requirements into Agile story form for implementation by our development team. Finally, the Business Analyst acts as a subject matter expert throughout a project to ensure that any questions from the technical or customer teams are answered in a timely fashion. What you'll do... Acts as a liaison between sales, business development, product management, the customer and the development team Understands and complies with business processes and procedures Information gathering Conducting market and product research Analyzing business needs Crafting solutions to interesting business challenges Developing requirements Creating and maintaining project documentation Coordinating the development and quality assurance, review and updating of procedures, training and communicationsEssential Job Functions Problem Solving/Brainstorming/Facilitating Requirements Definition/Agile Story Writing Meetings/Presentations/Demos Interface Prototyping/MockingWhat you'll bring... Electronic Health Record (EHR) or Pharmacy Management System (PMS) experience would help bring your resume to the top of the list 5+ years as a Business Analyst or equivalent experience working in the healthcare information systems and/ or Saas-based software industry Ability to determine target audience and create communications that are clear, concise and understandable Ability to establish strong working relationships with internal and external associates Experience working on agile teams is preferred Must have strong verbal and written communication skills Requires the ability to work in a rapidly changing environment Must have a passion to learn new things and problem solve Familiar with using JIRA and being an advocate for Agile software development practices Some travel is requiredPlease note this is not a remote position. All candidates must be able to work in the Dublin, OH office.

Name: Business Analyst- JDEdwards Finance
Description: We are dedicated to the belief that people are our most important asset. In filling job openings every effort is expended to find candidates within Worthington, its divisions or subsidiaries. Employee development, opportunity to grow and continuing to evolve both as an employee and as a company are instrumental to our success. We encourage employees to inquire about open positions and apply to those that help further their career goals. SummaryWorthington Industries is looking for an entry level JDEdwards Business Analyst. This person is responsible for supporting and improving how the organization utilizes JDE EnterpriseOne software. This includes production system issue resolution, trouble-shooting, and training. Also includes the analysis of business requirements, developing alternatives for improvement, creating formal system requests (as required), testing, documenting, and implementation planning. Plays a role in the implementation of JDE for new acquisitions, and additional applications/systems.This person should have a basic knowledge of JDE applications, and will be trained on Worthington Industries’ specific requirements and initiatives. This position comes with the opportunity to travel domestically and internationally.ResponsibilitiesHas a basic knowledge of JDE functional applications supported: (Manufacturing, Distribution, with an emphasis on Finance & Accounting) Current functionality, planned functionality, pain-points, workarounds, impacts, timetables, etc.Manages the research, resolution, escalation and prioritization of business issues.Meets with business partners, stakeholders, and solution leads to understand current system needs, future goals, and help to establish realistic timetables for completion.Facilitates and executes efforts related to system configuration changes (set-up, testing, compliance, and analysis of results).Develops necessary documentation associated with recommended business system changes.Meets with internal IT staff to communicate/educate the business’ desired system changes.Willingness to travel.Other duties as assigned.Desired ExperienceAbility to work effectively with cross functional departments Detail and process orientedFlexible and adaptable to changeSelf-motivated and possesses the ability to complete tasks on time and with little supervisionVery good problem solving skillsMust have above average written, verbal communication skillsExcellent organizational skillsEducationBachelors in Business or Information Systems Bachelors or equivalent in Accounting or Finance Worthington Industries Inc., and its subsidiaries, is an equal employment opportunity employer. Qualified applicants are considered regardless of race, color, religion, age, national origin, sex, disability or veteran’s status.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: OverviewAt Perficient you’ll deliver mission-critical technology and business solutions to Fortune 500 companies and some of the most recognized brands on the planet. And you’ll do it with cutting-edge technologies, thanks to our close partnerships with the world’s biggest vendors. Our network of offices across North America, as well as locations in India and China, will give you the opportunity to spread your wings, too.  We’re proud to be publicly recognized as a “Top Workplace” year after year. This is due, in no small part, to our entrepreneurial attitude and collaborative spirit that sets us apart and keeps our colleagues impassioned, driven, and fulfilled.  Perficient currently has a career opportunity for a Business Analyst in our Columbus office. Job Overview: The role of the Business Analyst is for individuals passionate about identifying and delivering the right Business solution for each client. Our Business Analysts have a keen Business orientation with an understanding of how technology can be effectively applied to meet a variety of Business needs.  Our Business Analysts fill a number of different roles on our project teams working with a variety of technologies for a wide range of clients. The specific responsibilities vary for each client and each project. Key to the success of our Business Consultants is the willingness and desire to quickly learn the client’s industry and the unique requirements of each engagement and to fill whatever role may be required to best support our client’s needs.  A Business Analyst thrives in challenging environments and accomplishes difficult assignments without significant supervision and instruction. Our Consultants can handle the stress of being accountable for delivery and: complete goals on time, practice strong attention to detail, persevere through tough obstacles, and do not get easily discouraged.  The Business Analyst may be involved in the strategic planning of an engagement or helping the client make decisions about their future IT direction. Once a project has begun, the Business Analyst may assist in facilitating key requirements with stakeholders and customers using standard and User Experience techniques. The Business Consultant may be responsible for functional designs, detailed designs and system mapping, wireframes, requirement specifications, and prototypes.  The Business Analyst works with the Lead Business Analyst and Senior Project Managers to assist with daily operations exercising time management, communication and collaboration in a fast-paced environment to ensure the successful delivery of projects. The Business Analyst will interface with Perficient technical and business delivery personnel, as well as vendors and customers on a regular basis.ResponsibilitiesBuild trusted client relationships through proactive account management and effective project deliveryEstablishes knowledge of client business challenges and priorities to translate into opportunitiesMaintains regular client communication and satisfaction, ensuring opportunities and challenges are addressed in a timely manner.Helps deliver presentations to clients and management teamsContributes to project discoveries, kickoff, prepare proposals and statements of work following company standards.Translate client’s business needs into detailed business requirements documents, use cases and systems interaction diagrams.Works with customers and internal Creative teams to establish approved wireframes and mock-ups for solutionsAssists project team to establish high, mid, and micro level plans for project team.Helps to establish critical path, milestones, delivery dates, and review client deliverables to ensure they meet client acceptance criteria.Provides leadership throughout the lifecycles of a project, guiding the understanding the project team has through design and development to ensure project requirements are metHelps establish project test strategy, methodologies, test plans as well as assist with test execution. QualificationsBachelor’s Degree1-3 years of professional business analysis experience, with strong relationship management, account management, and support experience.Experience working with external clientsKnowledge of Agile and iterative development methodologiesUnderstanding of current technologies and Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC)Ability to obtain, understand and respond strategically to client needs.Highly detail oriented, well organized, and able to coordinate multiple projects simultaneously.Strong analytical, problem solving and conflict resolution skills.Energetic, motivated, service-oriented, and be able to multi task.Excellent listening, oral, and written communication skills.Strong interpersonal and teamwork skills.Flexible to new situations and challenges.Flexibility to travel up to 50 percent.Preferred skills and education:Degree in Computer Science or EngineeringExperience working in the consulting industryExperience working in financial industry a plusUnderstanding of complex Internet based enterprise level applicationsUnderstanding or background in testing a plusExperience working in an Agile environmentTrack record of delivering on time, on budget, and meeting client commitments Perficient full-time employees receive complete and competitive benefits. We offer a collaborative work environment, competitive compensation, generous work/life opportunities and an outstanding benefits package that includes paid time off plus holidays. In addition, all colleagues are eligible for a number of rewards and recognition programs including billable bonus opportunities. Encouraging a healthy work/life balance and providing our colleagues great benefits are just part of what makes Perficient a great place to work. More About Perficient Perficient is the leading digital transformation consulting firm serving Global 2000 and enterprise customers throughout North America. With unparalleled information technology, management consulting and creative capabilities, Perficient and its Perficient Digital agency deliver vision, execution and value with outstanding digital experience, business optimization and industry solutions.  Our work enables clients to improve productivity and competitiveness; grow and strengthen relationships with customers, suppliers and partners; and reduce costs. Perficient's professionals serve clients from a network of offices across North America and offshore locations in India and China. Traded on the Nasdaq Global Select Market, Perficient is a member of the Russell 2000 index and the S&P SmallCap 600 index. Perficient is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national, origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.Disclaimer: The above statements are not intended to be a complete statement of job content, rather to act as a guide to the essential functions performed by the employee assigned to this classification. Name: Business Analyst
Description: We are hiring a multi-skilled Business Analyst with passion for software development, who is an expert problem solver and possesses analytical ability to write/understand business requirements and transform them into world class software design.You will work in the growing Enterprise Contact Center Services team that is developing the next generation contact center core application technology. An amazing opportunity to be a key contributor to a transformational program that impacts our brand and the customer/ specialist experience. To leverage new technologies and innovation (digital, cloud), the platform needs to transition to an internet (IP) based multi-channel platform. Responsibilities include:Participate in Agile SDLC product development .Design machine learning based solutions that help automate processes in Consumer and Community Banking operationsIdentify gaps and weaknesses in existing applications and design and support implement remediation of these gaps.Work to improve the stability of applications in the production environment.Ensure changes to the applications follow a disciplined change management processes including all documentation, reviews, and approval steps using CHASE standard tool set for Automated testing , deployment Identify opportunities to Automate L3 tasks (Application Build, Application Deployment etc.).Required:5 years Business Analyst experience in a Software Engineering / Technical environment with proven background in:Problem Solving / Brainstorming / Facilitating Requirements Definition / Agile Story Writing / Use CasesWorkflow AnalysisPrototyping / Mocking Effective team player and mentor with strong communication and interpersonal skills, possess a strong ability to adapt and learn new technologies and new business lines rapidly.Nice to have skillsMachine Learning knowledge with experience in transforming business requirements into requirements that create analytical models, designing algorithms, and strategic solutions that scales across massive volumes of dataExperience in the entire data science project life cycle, including Data Acquisition, Data Cleaning, Data Manipulation, Data Mining, Machine Learning Algorithms, Data Validation, and Data Visualization. Name: Business Analyst
Description: MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS/EDUCATION /TRAINING REQUIRED:Experience upgrading prior versions of Office to Office 365 as a Business Analyst.- MUST HAVEPREFERRED:Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or related field. 5+ years of experience as a business analyst in support of business and technology projects with a strong preference for experience supporting child welfare services. Preferred character traits include: very strong customer focus, listening skills, oral and written communication skills; excellent judgment in ambiguous situations; proven ability to facilitate collaboration within cross-functional teams; well organized, and self-motivated. Preferred experience includes: creating business case documents, documenting requirements, developing business models (ex. entity/class diagrams, activity/process diagrams, state diagrams, conceptual models, RACI matrices, role/responsibility matrices, etc.), analyzing gaps between present and future states, reengineering business processes, making presentations to business teams and executive management, and generating work estimates. Preferred knowledge includes: SharePoint, PowerPoint, cloud-based solutions, packaged software implementation, computing infrastructure, agile and iterative system engineering processes, government operations, and Business Analyst Book of Knowledge (BABOK). International Institute of Business Analyst (IIBA) Certification. Need a valid driver's license and ability to drive when needed.PURPOSE:The employee shall provide expertise regarding FCCS business operations, collaborate with cross-functional teams to explore business process improvement opportunities, and shall model both present and future state business operations using various industry-standard modelling and analysis techniques in order to help move from the present to the future state. 1) The employee shall participate in agency projects by analyzing business processes, eliciting and documenting project requirements, ensuring requirements traceability throughout all project work products and project phases, contributing to test and implementation plans, and participating in system testing, user acceptance testing, and implementation. To achieve these ends, the employee shall facilitate meetings with customers and service delivery staff. 2) The employee shall also provide ongoing customer support for custom and packaged software solutions. 3) The employee shall also help improve the agencys business analysis procedures, standards, and project performance reporting. 4) The employee shall also help research new technologies, methodologies, and operating models to more quickly and efficiently achieve these objectives. The employee will help the agency achieve Child and Family Services Review (CFSR) standards and help ensure service delivery that focuses on Safety, Permanency and Well-being for the families served by the agency. The employee is committed to practicing cultural competence by: working respectfully and effectively with people of all cultures, classes, races, genders, ethnic backgrounds, religions, sexual orientations, mental and physical abilities, ages and appearances in a manner that recognizes, affirms and values the worth of individuals, families and communities and protects and preserves the dignity of each. The employee will adhere to the agencys Guiding Principles by serving as a child welfare professional, valuing every child, honoring families, and valuing partnerships.JOB DUTIES:85%The employee shall participate in the Office 365 Implementation project by analyzing business processes, eliciting and documenting project requirements, ensuring requirements traceability throughout all project work products and project phases, contributing to test and implementation plans, and participating in system testing, user acceptance testing, and implementation.5%Help improve the agencys business analysis procedures, standards, and project performance reporting.5%Research new technologies, methodologies, and operating models to more quickly and efficiently achieve these objectives.5%Perform other duties as assigned.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job Title: Business Analyst Location: 7400 Safelite Way, Columbus, Ohio 43235-5086 Full Time/Part Time: Full-time Req Number:18-1099Regular/Seasonal: Regular  Job Description:The Business Analyst is technically adept and highly interpersonal with limited experience and is responsible for requirements development and management. The BA will assist other BA's with moderate to complex projects or may individually handle assignments. BA's elicit, analyze, validate and document business, organizational and/or operational requirements based solely on the requirements of the business project. BA's create, manage, and publish departmental communications and will interact directly with the IT group as the customer. This person must be able to communicate with Developers regarding projects and requirements. Find a career. Gain a family. Safelite will be unlike any place you've ever worked. (This won't be just the daily grind!) You'll join caring and passionate teams that collaborate to make a difference, deliver extraordinary results and bring unexpected happiness. Every day. Your effort, heart and creative ideas will be valued and rewarded. And we care about your well-being. So, we'll strive to give you what you need to be happy at work and at home. Essential Activities:Provides assistance to the department by maintaining metrics, monitoring budgets, developing communications, and gaining increased familiarity with business areas.Defines and Scopes Business Projects Defines and documents project scopes. Gains good understanding of project reasoning, goals, and objectives. Analyses business initiative prior to determining solutions. Names and defines people, systems, departments, and outside vendors who will be involved in projects. Gains information necessary to prioritize and begin requirements gathering by defining and documenting project viewpoints, assumptions, and possible business risks. Produces a descriptive business process and organized system for maintaining project information.Researches & Gathers Requirements Gathers detailed requirements to thoroughly define projects by instinctively knowing and asking the 'right' questions to the 'right' people. Defines the difference between business need and software functionality. Assess project type, involved individuals, and volume of required information through a variety of vehicles and ensures that critical issues are adequately addressed.Analyzes, Documents, & Communicates Requirements Organizes requirements into business, functional, and technical categories. Utilizes consistent documentation format which may include textual descriptions, diagrams, and other graphical displays to clearly communicate and organize requirements in a manner understandable to technical individuals. Determines level of detail appropriate for project. Maintains current understanding of business and technical jargon and determines the most appropriate method of communication. Prepares and facilitates presentations to all associate and management levels.Identifies & Verify's SolutionsWorks closely with IT experts to identify solutions to design solutions. Assists in the design and testing of technical solutions, works with vendors to review and discuss products, writes or participates in the writing of RFI's and RFP's.Reviews proposed designs for usability and to assure requirements are satisfied.Reviews solutions and determines if original project objectives are met. Oversees technical and user testing. Documents and reports variances from original requirements. May assist in correcting variances.Supports IT Audit ProcessAssists in the annual audit process by ensuring independent auditors are provided with requested materials.Prepares Written Procedures  Becomes product expert by way of researching, testing, and familiarizing self with new products and/or systems. Prepares and implements detailed, organized, and user-friendly written procedures for product and/or system end users. May develop and conduct end-user training programs utilizing a variety of training vehicles.Facilitates inter-departmental enterprise change meetings. Determines and documents recent changes, updates test directors, and prepares and provides written reports to appropriate management.Improves business processes. Observes various business processes and identifies and recommends opportunities for improvement.Support procurement of new products or systems by conducting extensive product research and preparing detailed written reports to management.Performs other duties as assigned.Requirements:Bachelors degree in MIS, CIS, technical communications or related field required.Two to four years business, IT, or related experience required.Knowledge of: IT, general business operations; process mapping, technical and business jargon; project management practices; interviewing & facilitation techniques; basic software design and development; basic understanding of system design; and project scope documentation techniques.Ability to: exercise sound judgment; demonstrate flexibility and initiative; coordinate multiple activities and tasks; solve problems; display objectivity; collect and analyze data, establish facts and draw valid conclusions; maintain confidentiality; maintain accurate and complete work records; clearly document project scopes using business terminology; categorize requirements; understand basic system development methodologies; utilize appropriate modeling techniques; facilitate meetings; conduct informal presentations; write in a clear manner; understand business problems; calculate basic cost estimates; build business cases for implementation; and apply test principles.Skill in: verbal and written communication; interviewing; operating office equipment; operating a personal computer and job related software; planning, scheduling, and organizing work priorities; maintaining good business relations; collaborating; working with detailed data; conflict resolution; identifying and implementing best practices; performing mathematical calculations; bringing multiple groups together to agree on project scopes and build consensus; fact-finding and asking the right questions; effective listening; note taking and documentation; and analyzing data.Apply now! We're known as an auto glass company. That's the focus of what we do. But we're much more -- we're a growing and evolving service brand. And what really makes us unique is our people. Because at our core, we're a People Powered organization -- and our people come first and our culture matters. We'll help you find a fulfilling career path and encourage you to have a life. Let us be the best place you'll ever work.  Learn more.

program/projectGather and analyze data, providing facts related to a technology request or projectLeverage enterprise portfolio data to analyze and identify dependent projects or requestsDevelop project artifacts to support a project or programProtect scope on projects, ensuring efforts are focused on the work that drives business benefitOn-board new employeesPerforms other related duties as assignedQualificationsEXPECTATIONS:Be a self-starter, working independently while ensuring alignment with team and managerArticulate requests in a clear and concise well told storyApply "Do/Observe/Refine" methodology to all tasks and share learnings with the teamParticipate in continuous improvement activitiesApply problem solving skills to proactively identify risksWork with empathy, humility and curiosityListen to understand, ask questions to learn and seek clarityArticulate a perspective based upon dataApply demonstrated ability to build and nurture relationshipsCollaborate and partner across multiple teamsBe open to direct and candid feedbackEmbrace change and work effectively in a fast paced, every changing environmentWork with a strong sense of initiative and urgency, remaining focused on the priorities and ensuring alignment with managerShow courage to present new ideas and ways of doing thingsParticipate in respectful and healthy discussions where differing opinions are sharedNOTE: QUALIFICATIONS AND EDUCATION TO ALIGN WITH WHATEVER WAS SPECIFIED IN THE LADDER An equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate in hiring or terms and conditions of employment because of an individual's race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, age, disability, sexual orientation, marital status or any other protected category recognized by state, federal or local laws. Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job Title: Business Analyst Apply PrintLocation: Columbus  OHRequired Skills: business analyst, SharePoint, PowerPoint, cloud-based solutions, packaged software implementation, computing infrastructure, agileJob Description: JOB TITLE: Business Analyst  Location: Columbus, OH  Interviews: Onsite interview required  Business Analyst  FCCS requests a Business Analyst for the upgrade of our current Office 2013 environment to Office 365. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS/EDUCATION /TRAINING REQUIRED: Experience upgrading prior versions of Office to Office 365 as a Business Analyst. PREFERRED: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field. 5+ years of experience as a business analyst in support of business and technology projects with a strong preference for experience supporting child welfare services. Preferred character traits include: very strong customer focus, listening skills, oral and written communication skills; excellent judgment in ambiguous situations; proven ability to facilitate collaboration within cross-functional teams; well organized, and self-motivated. Preferred experience includes: creating business case documents, documenting requirements, developing business models (ex. entity/class diagrams, activity/process diagrams, state diagrams, conceptual models, RACI matrices, role/responsibility matrices, etc.), analyzing gaps between present and future states, reengineering business processes, making presentations to business teams and executive management, and generating work estimates. Preferred knowledge includes: SharePoint, PowerPoint, cloud-based solutions, packaged software implementation, computing infrastructure, agile and iterative system engineering processes, government operations, and Business Analyst Book of Knowledge (BABOK). International Institute of Business Analyst (IIBA) Certification. Need a valid driver's license and ability to drive when needed. PURPOSE: The employee shall provide expertise regarding FCCS business operations, collaborate with cross-functional teams to explore business process improvement opportunities, and shall model both present and future state business operations using various industry-standard modelling and analysis techniques in order to help move from the present to the future state. 1) The employee shall participate in agency projects by analyzing business processes, eliciting and documenting project requirements, ensuring requirements traceability throughout all project work products and project phases, contributing to test and implementation plans, and participating in system testing, user acceptance testing, and implementation. To achieve these ends, the employee shall facilitate meetings with customers and service delivery staff. 2) The employee shall also provide ongoing customer support for custom and packaged software solutions. 3) The employee shall also help improve the agency’s business analysis procedures, standards, and project performance reporting. 4) The employee shall also help research new technologies, methodologies, and operating models to more quickly and efficiently achieve these objectives. The employee will help the agency achieve Child and Family Services Review (CFSR) standards and help ensure service delivery that focuses on Safety, Permanency and Well-being for the families served by the agency. The employee is committed to practicing cultural competence by: working respectfully and effectively with people of all cultures, classes, races, genders, ethnic backgrounds, religions, sexual orientations, mental and physical abilities, ages and appearances in a manner that recognizes, affirms and values the worth of individuals, families and communities and protects and preserves the dignity of each. The employee will adhere to the agency’s Guiding Principles by serving as a child welfare professional, valuing every child, honoring families, and valuing partnerships. JOB DUTIES: 85% The employee shall participate in the Office 365 Implementation project by analyzing business processes, eliciting and documenting project requirements, ensuring requirements traceability throughout all project work products and project phases, contributing to test and implementation plans, and participating in system testing, user acceptance testing, and implementation.  5% Help improve the agency’s business analysis procedures, standards, and project performance reporting.  5% Research new technologies, methodologies, and operating models to more quickly and efficiently achieve these objectives.  5% Perform other duties as assigned.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: At Scotts Miracle-Gro we think people are like plants....in the right place you will grow and flourish. Are you an advocate of making the world a more beautiful place by inspiring others, championing new ideas and being intellectually curious? Are you not afraid to roll up your sleeves and get your hands dirty? If so, then we want you as part of our Scotts family...the world's largest marketer of branded consumer lawn and garden care products!  We are looking for a Business Analyst who will join our Business Transformation (IT) team.  This position will be based at The Scotts Miracle-Gro world headquarters in Marysville, a suburb of Columbus, OH. Not familiar with Columbus? Visit columbusregion.com/columbus-2020/  Scotts Miracle-Gro established the Business Transformation (BT) group to work with the business to develop plans to align technology and process resources with the business strategy. These plans include continuing efforts to support our base business in leveraging existing technologies and solutions to realize continuous improvements, improve the productivity of our global workforce, address the need for more effective and efficient communication of information, and support for the evolving business model to grow with our "Consumer First" strategy.  This position contributes to the success of the BT group through the governance of communications and organizational change management within the department, as well as governance of project methodology, improvement and management of key processes.  In this role you will: Communications and Organizational Change ManagementDrive communication and organizational change management efforts for BT.Portfolio Planning and Project GovernanceLead and/or consult on communication and organizational change management activities for specific projects/initiatives (e.g., as a formal member of a project team).BT Process Management & ImprovementLead the communication processes and quality of the content of information and distribution of the departmental weekly status report.Service Desk ManagementProvide leadership oversight for our Outsourced Service Desk team. Serve as the primary liaison between BT and our Outsource provider. The perfect person will have: Minimum of 5 years of communications experience - IT experience a plus.Minimum of 3 years of organizational change management experience - IT experience a plus.Portfolio Planning - experience defining and prioritizing multi-year plans that align with business strategy.Business Process Transformation - minimum 3 years experience in business process design and improvement which includes success in designing sustainable business processes to drive expected business results.Conceptual and/or practical knowledge and experience of using information technologies (e.g. SAP) to support business processes.Strong verbal and written communication skills, with an ability to effectively express complex concepts in simple business terms across all levels of the organization.Strong analytical, problem-solving, and conceptual skills.Ability to think strategically and plan effectively.Conceptual and/or demonstrated project management knowledge and experience.Financial management skills including proven competency in business case development.Proven business process design and improvement skills including experience using structured process improvement methods.Ability to influence and gain alignment with people at all levels in the organization, on the approach and timing to implement solutions to strategic business problems.Strong perseverance abilities in the face of challenges and an ability to deal with conflicts constructively.Ability to partner with peers, team members and demonstrate collaborative, effective teamwork.Comfort and flexibility with changing priorities, high levels of ambiguity, and non-routine issues.Ability to multi-task in fast-paced deadline intensive environment.Ability to anticipate obstacles and plan contingencies.Core competencies: Problem Solving & Analysis. Business Acumen. Communication & Leadership. Relationship Building. Creativity & Innovation. Influence and Organizational Savvy. Planning & Organizing. What we do for our associates (just to list a few cool ones): Offer extremely competitive benefits including: Health, Dental and Vision coverage.Onsite wellness center which includes: 2,400 sq. ft. fitness center, Walgreens pharmacy and Doctor’s office.Beautiful campus and corporate offices designed like a log cabin offering free coffee, chef run cafe and the best crushed ice!Unbelievable 401K match and discounted stock purchasing program.Our commitment to diversity and inclusion includes four employee resource groups: Scotts Women’s Network, Scotts Black Employee Network, Scotts Veterans Network and Scotts Young Professionals.Generous vacation day policy.Various associate engagement activities throughout the year including intramural sports leagues. COME GROW WITH US, WHERE THE GRASS REALLY IS GREENER!  Not interested in this role? Check out our other career opportunities and learn more about what it’s like to work at Scotts Miracle-Gro by accessing our Talent Network: SMG Talent Network  The Scotts Miracle-Gro Company (NYSE: SMG) is the world's largest marketer of branded consumer lawn and garden products, with a full range of products for professional horticulture as well. Scotts Miracle-Gro has helped to grow the nearly $7 billion global consumer lawn and garden market through product innovation, industry-leading advertising efforts and its trusted brands.  The brands and products within our portfolio include: Scotts, Miracle-Gro, TomCat, Ortho, RoundUp, Bonnie Plants, Osmocote, Earthgro and Fafard.  Scotts is an EEO Employer, dedicated to a culturally diverse, drug free workplace.  EEO/AA Employer/Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity Notification to Agencies: Please note that the Scotts Miracle-Gro company does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Master Service Agreement, and specific approval to submit resumes to an approved requisition, the Scotts Miracle-Gro company will not consider or approve payment regarding recruiter fees or referral compensations.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Working at ICFWorking at ICF means applying a passion for meaningful work with intellectual rigor to help solve the leading issues of our day. Smart, compassionate, innovative, committed, ICF employees tackle unprecedented challenges to benefit people, businesses, and governments around the globe. We believe in collaboration, mutual respect, open communication, and opportunity for growth. If you’re seeking to make a difference in the world, visit www.icf.com/careers to find your next career. ICF—together for tomorrow.Who we are: Audacious. Ingenious. Real. If that sounds like you, you’ll fit right in. Olson Digital is a new breed of agency, purpose-built for marketing’s new realities. Olson Digital's full-service solutions crack complex challenges. Digital has completely transformed the customer experience, and consumers are connected in ways we’ve never seen—ways that challenge marketers and IT alike. Whether it's helping you speak to your customers, providing a richer digital experience, or deploying platforms that deliver results, we have you covered. Overview: ICF Olson has an exciting opportunity for an experienced Business Analyst responsible for providing analysis for strategic, complex initiatives in support of multiple lines of businesses throughout Olson Digital. This role requires an individual to be able to think \"out-of-box\" in client solution development and work collaboratively with clients to conduct stakeholder interviews, identify business process impacts, and elicit business & functional requirements Role DescriptionPerform requirements gathering through interviews, document and artifact analysis, facilitated workshop sessions, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, user stories, scenarios, business analysis, task and workflow analysisBring strong analytical skills to bear on projects, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret client business needs and translate them into detailed user stories & functional specificationsDrive and challenge business stakeholders on requirements, processes, and solution drivers to ensure an appropriate level of detail and to remove ambiguityCommunicate and collaborate proactively with external and internal clients to analyze information and functional needs and deliver functional requirements, business requirements, and user storiesCollaborate with Creative team and ensure that User Experience and Visual Design align with required functionalityProvide support to Technical and QA teams to provide guidance and clarifications regarding requirement questionsGain thorough understanding of client and business needs in order to provide consultative insights and fill role of business partnerSkills and KnowledgeBS or 3-5 years’ experience in documenting requirementsExperience working in the digital agency or consulting firm spaceWillingness to travel as required for client engagementsExcellent presentation and communications skills that establish trust, credibility and respectFamiliarity with and aptitude to understand ecommerce, CRM, and CMS platforms supported by Olson Digital, such as Hybris, Sitecore, Marketo, Adobe AEM, Salesforce, or similarExperience with the Atlassian Suite (Jira, Confluence)Excellent attention to detail with a strong understanding of businessAbility to manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced, self-motivated, and self-managed environmentExperience with Adobe Analytics or similar analytics program is highly desirableExperience working with highly distributed and offshore teamsFamiliarity with different development methodologies including Agile, Iterative and Waterfall ICF Olson is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity at all levels. (EOE – Minorities/Females/ Protected Veterans Status/Disability Status/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity)Fairfax, VA (VA01)

Name: BUSINESS ANALYST
Description: SOLUTIONS ANALYST (Business Analyst)  Leading EDJE helps our partners solve their most complex business challenges by building them the highest quality custom software….and we do it better than anyone else! Since 2007, we have created a unique culture which promotes high positive energy with an entrepreneurial spirit.  Our firm is made of exceptionally talented professionals who deliver exceptional results, and our clients are made from a wide array of industries but have a common goal of choosing a partner who provides distinct, creative solutions.  We choose to work and live deliberately via our uncompromising core values, of Put Team First, Is Dedicated to Growth, Does the Right Thing…Not the Right Now Thing, Approaches Problem Solving Passionately and Communicates Clearly and Authentically. It is an absolute must that our team members share these values and embrace them both professionally and personally. QUALIFICATIONS The ideal Solutions Analyst is a creative thinker, who thrives on innovation and thinks outside the box. Understanding how to approach complex issues, and gathering detailed requirements is critical when delivering a quality solution and meeting expectations.  Leading EDJE team members (we call ourselves EDJErs) are passionate about technology continuous learners, who thrive on keeping up with the latest technology trends. They take advantage of every opportunity to learn and grow their skills and knowledge.  As a Solutions Analyst, you will be involved in all phases of software development, from requirements definition to production releases. We work in an environment that encourages individual initiative, leadership at all levels, and team-based continuous improvement. RESPONSIBILITIES Solutions Analysts must possess strong leadership skills and an ability to provide oversight and mentorship to junior level associates and be able to perform the following: Will to deliver effective, clear, and consistent functional and technical documentation supporting one or more projectsWill be required to facilitate communications between and among highly experienced business and IT associatesProvide documentation of one or more projects in coordination with cross-functionality team members.SPECIFICATIONSRequired This role will require someone to be an excellent communicator and have the ability to reach across departments/skillsets/levels to attain the proper information and get stakeholder buy-in. In addition, the Solutions Analyst should possess the following: Ability to facilitate Requirements/Design/Test workshops between diverse teamsAbility to clearly define/write detailed business requirements including functional/non-functionalAbility to facilitate and define sprint sessions/story groomingEnd-to-End understanding of project lifecycle - defining scope and requirements clearly through testing and system implementationPreferredPersonal Attributes: Confident, Self-starter, Strong work ethic, Highly motivated, Sense of humor, A Winning ‘Will-Do’ attitude, Team orientedExpert knowledge of 2 or more project management/software development tools (Jira, Trello, MS Project, Clarity, etc.)Experience with SAFe processes a plus.WHAT SETS LEADING EDJE APART FROM OTHER CONSULTING COMPANIES?Leadership says:Founded in 2007, Leading EDJE is a stable organizationFocused on organic growth, providing quality over quantityA family-friendly culture focused on team members’ personal and professional growthOpportunity for advancementWell respected within the technical community for providing superior servicesA team of A players who respect and trust one anotherThe team says:Fun, inspiring and engaging work environmentExtremely talented employeesPassion to do the right thing for our clients, our team, and our imageEffective communication at all levels/positionsLeading EDJE is truly a company that practices what it preachesLeadership team openly accepts the feedback and tries to come up with a solution that will work for most peopleProfessional growth is encouraged and enforced on an individual levelSupportive, trusting, and open relationshipsCommitment to team 11.12.2018

(Capture additional requirements based on design, capture global rules for system consistency).Experience in coordinating and supporting User Acceptance Testing (UAT).Assist with end-user training and create any training artifacts if needed. Six (6) years experience eliciting and defining system and user requirements through observation, interviews, and analysis.Six (6) years experience working directly with end-users to define requirements and provide technical advice and assistance in a large-scale environment.Four (4) years experience translating customer needs into formal business requirements.Three (3) years experience interviewing non-technical end users to determine and document current business process flows.Four (4) years experience in Business Process Re-engineering.Four (4) years experience using Visio to create business process flows including standard flowcharts and swim lane diagrams.Three (3) years experience creating test conditions, test cases, and test scenarios.Four (4) years experience analyzing end-user needs and conducting fit gap analysis.Documented experience as a technical Business Analyst from project initiation through completion on a minimum of two (2) software development or implementation projects requiring a minimum of two thousand (2,000) Full-time Equivalent (FTE) hours to complete.Documented experience using project management software (e.g. Microsoft Project or Clarity) to develop and maintain a Work Breakdown Structure (WBS) on a minimum of two (2) projects.Four (4) years experience using a business requirements tracking tool for recording and prioritization of business requirements.Documented experience in systems process and data mapping, requirements gathering, and analysis as well as proficiency in the creation of detailed documentation.Needs to show at least 1 experience with a large organization as ODPS.Needs to have used AGILE in one organizationNeeds to have used the Agile Alignment within BABOK in at least one organization. Experience using Microsoft Team Foundation Server to document requirements and collaborate with other members of the team Experience working as a Business Analyst in a DevOPS environmentIIBA certification
