Name: Business Analyst
Description: Description:*6 month contract to hire May need to travel to Columbus, GA once or twice for a meeting Requirements Lead Role Description Description: The requirements lead is the individual who has the primary responsibility to elicit, analyze, validate, specify, verify, and manage the real needs of the project stakeholders, including customers and end users. The requirements lead serves as the conduit between the customer community and the software development team through which requirements flow.  A requirements lead is involved at some level throughout the entire system or software development life cycle. Upon establishment of the requirements baseline, the focus is shifted towards the management of the requirements specification and verifying the fulfillment of all requirements.  The requirements lead functions is a project role. The requirements lead is responsible for seeing that the tasks are performed properly either by themselves or in partnership with business analyst or solution analyst that are a part of the team. Skills Needed:Interviewing skills, to talk with individuals and groups about their needs and ask the right questions to surface essential requirements informationListening skills, to understand what people say and to detect what they might be hesitant to sayAnalytical skills, to critically evaluate the information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a more general understanding, distinguish presented user requests from the underlying true needs, and distinguish solution ideas from requirementsFacilitation skills, to lead requirements elicitation workshopsObservational skills, to validate data obtained via other techniques and expose new areas for elicitationWriting skills, to communicate information effectively to customers, marketing, managers, and technical staffOrganizational skills, to work with the vast array of information gathered during elicitation and analysis and to cope with rapidly changing informationInterpersonal skills, to help negotiate priorities and to resolve conflicts among project stakeholders (such as customers, product management, and engineering)Modeling skills, to represent requirements information in graphical forms that augment textual representations in natural language, including using modeling languages already established in the development organization.Knowledge Needed:Banking experience required with specialty in Commercial card business as a plus or card services business (i.e.retail etc)10 years experience in requirements management processes and techniques with large scale programs.Experience with working with vendors to gather requirements for third party system. TSYS experience a plus.An understanding of contemporary requirements elicitation, analysis, specification, verification, and management practices and the ability to apply them in practice; familiarity with requirements engineering books and resourcesAn understanding of how to practice requirements management according to several software development life cycles in a team environmentKnowledge of product management concepts and how enterprise software products are positioned and developedApplication domain knowledge is a plus, to have credibility with user representatives and be able to work effectively with themResponsibilities:Work with the project manager, product manager, and/or project sponsor to document the product’s vision and the project’s scope.Identify project stakeholders and user classes. Document user class characteristics. Identify appropriate representatives for each user class and negotiate their responsibilities.Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, storyboards, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, event lists, business analysis, competitive product analysis, task and workflow analysis, and/or viewpoints.Write requirements specifications according to standard templates, using natural language simply, clearly, unambiguously, and concisely.Make recommendations for how requirements will be structured, stored and managed through-out across the program.Manage requirements traceability information and track requirements status throughout the project.Decompose high-level business and user requirements into functional requirements and quality, specified in an appropriate level of detail suitable for use by those must base their work on the requirements.Define quality attributes, external interfaces, constraints, and other nonfunctional requirements.Represent requirements using alternative views, such as analysis models (diagrams), prototypes, or scenarios, where appropriate.Lead requirements analysis and verification, ensuring that requirement statements are complete, consistent, concise, comprehensible, traceable, feasible, unambiguous, and verifiable, and that they conform to standards.Participate in requirements prioritization.Identify requirements errors and defects, and write requirements defect identification and notification reports.Manage changes to baselined requirements through effective application of change control processes and tools.Establish and implement effective requirements practices, including use and continuous improvement of a requirements process. Assist with the development of the organization’s requirements engineering policies, procedures, and tools.Implement ways to reuse requirements across projects.Identify ways to assist product management in product planning through requirements development and analysis. Propose new product features and updates.Measures of Performance:Evaluation from product and program management on overall product quality and effectiveness in the marketplace of the requirements after the product has been developedFeedback from key customer or marketing representatives on the way in which the requirements process was conductedCustomer satisfaction measures as defined by the programSatisfying or exceeding requirements development schedules, resource constraints, and quality goalsControl of requirements creep attributable to missed requirements and leakage of “unofficial” requirements into the project

Name: Pricing Analyst
Description: DESCRIPTION Kimball Midwest, a national distributor of maintenance, repair and operation products, is searching for a Pricing Analyst in our Marketing Department for our Columbus, OH location. We are looking for an assertive, hardworking, motivated, and customer focused individual.  Our Pricing Analyst will be responsible for operating the total pricing systems function of the company, providing customer service to sales representatives via phone, effectively report the status of the pricing function and to recommend and institute pricing adjustments, and maintain compliance with all applicable agency, governmental policies, rules, procedures, and laws. QUALIFICATIONSOur Ideal Candidate:Has a business degree or equivalent work historyHas a high degree of number acuity and ability to analyze reasons for profit performanceHas knowledge of the company’s product line and market driven influences affecting pricingHas a high degree of accuracy in both written and verbal skillHas an intermediate level of Microsoft Excel knowledgeHas the ability to read and write small letters and numbers plus the ability to make arithmetic calculationsHas the ability to understand and follow oral and written instructionsSuccessfully completes a ninety (90) day orientation period ADDITIONAL INFORMATION We offer a benefits package that includes health, dental and vision insurance, company sponsored life, optional life and disability insurance, Health Savings Accounts and Flexible Spending Accounts, a 401(k) and Profit Sharing Plan, Tuition Assistance, Paid Time Off (PTO), a business casual dress code and paid holidays.  Please apply online at www.kimballmidwest.com.  Equal Opportunity Employer

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Role: Business Analyst  Location: Columbus, OH  12 month assignment  Prefer Locals  C2C or 1099  Business Analyst for the upgrade of our current Office 2013 environment to Office 365. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS/EDUCATION /TRAINING REQUIRED: Six months experience as a Management Analyst 1 / Business Analyst or completion of undergraduate major program core course work in business administration, management science, or public administration, and 6 months experience in research & analysis and written documentation of findings; or 3 years of experience in research & analysis and written documentation of findings. PREFERRED: Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or related field. 5+ years of experience as a business analyst in support of business and technology projects with a strong preference for experience supporting child welfare services. Experience upgrading prior versions of Office to Office 365. Preferred character traits include: very strong customer focus, listening skills, oral and written communication skills; excellent judgment in ambiguous situations; proven ability to facilitate collaboration within cross-functional teams; well organized, and self-motivated. Preferred experience includes: creating business case documents, documenting requirements, developing business models (ex. entity/class diagrams, activity/process diagrams, state diagrams, conceptual models, RACI matrices, role/responsibility matrices, etc.), analyzing gaps between present and future states, reengineering business processes, making presentations to business teams and executive management, and generating work estimates. Preferred knowledge includes: SharePoint, PowerPoint, cloud-based solutions, packaged software implementation, computing infrastructure, agile and iterative system engineering processes, government operations, and Business Analyst Book of Knowledge (BABOK). International Institute of Business Analyst (IIBA) Certification. Need a valid driver's license and ability to drive when needed. PURPOSE: The employee shall provide expertise regarding FCCS business operations, collaborate with cross-functional teams to explore business process improvement opportunities, and shall model both present and future state business operations using various industry-standard modelling and analysis techniques in order to help move from the present to the future state. 1) The employee shall participate in agency projects by analyzing business processes, eliciting and documenting project requirements, ensuring requirements traceability throughout all project work products and project phases, contributing to test and implementation plans, and participating in system testing, user acceptance testing, and implementation. To achieve these ends, the employee shall facilitate meetings with customers and service delivery staff. 2) The employee shall also provide ongoing customer support for custom and packaged software solutions. 3) The employee shall also help improve the agencys business analysis procedures, standards, and project performance reporting. 4) The employee shall also help research new technologies, methodologies, and operating models to more quickly and efficiently achieve these objectives. The employee will help the agency achieve Child and Family Services Review (CFSR) standards and help ensure service delivery that focuses on Safety, Permanency and Well-being for the families served by the agency. The employee is committed to practicing cultural competence by: working respectfully and effectively with people of all cultures, classes, races, genders, ethnic backgrounds, religions, sexual orientations, mental and physical abilities, ages and appearances in a manner that recognizes, affirms and values the worth of individuals, families and communities and protects and preserves the dignity of each. The employee will adhere to the agencys Guiding Principles by serving as a child welfare professional, valuing every child, honoring families, and valuing partnerships. JOB DUTIES: 85%  The employee shall participate in the Office 365 Implementation project by analyzing business processes, eliciting and documenting project requirements, ensuring requirements traceability throughout all project work products and project phases, contributing to test and implementation plans, and participating in system testing, user acceptance testing, and implementation.  5%  Help improve the agencys business analysis procedures, standards, and project performance reporting.  5%  Research new technologies, methodologies, and operating models to more quickly and efficiently achieve these objectives.  5%  Perform other duties as assigned. *Position is subject to call-in during non-working hours as necessary* Job Type: Contract

Name: Business System Analyst
Description: Our Global Technology Infrastructure group is a team of innovators rewarded with innovators who love technology as much as you do. Together, you’ll use a disciplined, innovative and a business focused approach to develop a wide variety of high-quality products and solutions. You’ll work in a stable, resilient and secure operating environment where you—and the products you deliver—will thrive.As a Business System Analyst you will be responsible for the development and implementation of processes necessary to improve application / system reliability along with operational support. The BSA will support the production processes that utilize the systems, identify table impacts and work with IT and partners to test and implement requested updates.  This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including: Work with internal clients to formulate and innovate theoretical processes (using technology) that add business valueAbility to work in databases to perform analysis, data mining and reportingAnalyze patterns of production incidents, develop permanent remediation plans, and implement automation to prevent future incidents from occurring through software engineeringMaintain a good relationship with key sponsorsCapture of business requirements and use cases Driving requirements through user due diligence and sign offPartner with developers to ensure requirements are implemented as per specificationBachelor's degree (or equivalent experience) in Computer Science/EngineeringExperience working in an Agile Development environmentKnowledge in performance engineering and monitoring Knowledge of Configuration Management tools Ability to clearly define and articulate business requirements.Excellent written, verbal and presentation communication skillsExcellent analytical/problem-solving skillsProject management skills, including breaking requirements down into technical deliverables and estimating Experience and/or willing to be involved in the technical detail of projects and systemsProactive, self-motivated and flexible with a positive attitudeStrong time management skills; efficient at multi-tasking and able to work under pressure to deliver multiple business demands on-time, to a high-level standard work requiredWhen you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co., you’re not just working at a global financial institution. You’re an integral part of one of the world’s biggest tech companies. In 14 technology hubs worldwide, our team of 40,000 technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $9.5B annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that will not only transform the financial services industry, but also change the world. At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of every employee, and we’re building a technology organization that thrives on diversity. We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation. If you’re looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you.

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Vertex Systems is a 30 year old software company with leading edge technology. Our primary customers are agencies that serve people with barriers to employment. From sub-minimum wage payroll calculations to Department of Labor compliance to case management and Medicaid/Units-of-Service billing solutions, our products have been tested and field-proven by social service professionals all over the country.Using Vertex software gives our customers the freedom to do what they do best: help people lead more independent lives. Our customers appreciate and count on the assistance, training and technical support we provide. We’re helping agencies meet the complex, ever-changing demands involved in providing vital social services.  Senior Business Analyst  As a key member of our team, the Senior Business Analyst will serve as intermediary between our customers and the software development team. The Senior Business Analyst will work with the customer gathering requirements and performing analysis to produce artifacts required for software development to occur. We are looking for a candidate who is truly passionate about their career and consider it an important aspect of their life. We seek an assertive individual who can help us fulfill superior requirements for our clients. Responsibilities: Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, customer online community, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, and task and workflow analysis  Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high level information into details, abstract up from low level information to a general understanding and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs  Proactively communicate and collaborate with customers and other staff members to analyze information needs and functional requirements and deliver the artifacts Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Business, Software Engineering or Computer Science  5+ years of business analysis in software development with 1 year of project leadership experience  Ability to work independently with users to define concepts and under direction of product and project managers  Ability to drive and challenge business units on their assumptions of how they will successfully execute their plans  Ability to engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously  Strong analytical and product management skills, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements  Excellent communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group of executives, managers and subject matter experts  Ability to collaborate with developers and subject matter experts to establish the technical vision and analyze tradeoffs between usability and performance needs  Familiarity with Jira and mock up tools, non-profit entities, health care services, medical case management and financial reporting systems a plus Benefits: We value our employees’ time and efforts. Our commitment to your success is enhanced by our competitive salary and an extensive benefits package including paid time off, 401k, medical, dental and vision benefits and future growth opportunities within the company. Plus, we work to maintain the best possible environment for our employees, where people can learn and grow with the company. We strive to provide a collaborative, creative environment where each person feels encouraged to contribute to our processes, decisions, planning and culture.  We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Name: Junior Business Analyst
Description: Junior Business Analyst As the Business Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing, defining, documenting and testing business and system requirements for complex, high profile projects. You will act as a liaison between management, developers, quality assurance and the business partners. Skills & ExperienceExperience/Knowledge in capturing, analyzing and documenting business requirementsAbility to capture requirements with efficiency, accuracy, and attention to detail on a consistent basisExperience conducting interviews with key stakeholders to gather pertinent informationInteract with executives, managers, subject matter experts and development teamsExperience documenting requirements using use cases, activity diagrams and domain modelsObject-oriented designCollaboration with QA team to develop and manage test plansPreferredKnowledge of HP ALM or HPQCExperience working with software developmentPreferred QualificationsMaster's Degree in Computer Science or equivalent technical Degree

Name: Watson Health - Business Analyst Lead
Description: Job Description As a Lead Business Analyst, you will provide subject matter expertise both internally and externally to the data warehouse center of excellence and customers alike. You must possess a unique blend of business and technical savvy; a big-picture vision, and the drive to make that vision a reality. You must enjoy spending time in the market to understand their problems, and find innovative solutions for the broader market. You must be able to communicate with all areas of the company. You will work with an engineering counterpart to define product release requirements. You may be asked to travel as is necessary. You will oversee day-to-day activities of the business analyst team responsible for specifying business requirements to support the technical design and application development of healthcare reporting solutions. Essential Responsibilities:Lead a multi-disciplinary team of Business Analysts in a rapid and ever changing business environment.Lead the customer through steps of Agile/Iterative Methodology associated with the delivery of BI solutions; Requirements, Design, Development, System Test, User Acceptance Test and OperationsResponsible for facilitating customer Requirement Analysis Sessions (RAS) and is responsible for capturing and documenting customer business process models (BPM)Acts as a representative from the business area and to identify and refine their requirements for information, informing the creation of a warehouse data modelInteracts with functional users and data stewards/SME to ensure that all the proper questions have been identified and answered satisfactorilyClarify issues relating to scope and business requirements for project team (including technical implementation team, project management and client management)Assists Quality Assurance team with development, execution, and documentation of test casesWorks to identify and document data quality issuesAssists Data Modelers and Data Analysts in assuring requirements are traceable between the source data and target tables/entities in the respective data modelsLeads RAS sessions with clientsWorks with Implementation and Development leads to translate and map business requirements to technical requirements/specificationsDefines scope of work for work proposed to meet business requirementsDefine business requirements for change requests, investigate issues/defects and define remediation requirementsOversee the day to day activities of the Business Analysis team including but not limited to assignments, scheduling, performance evaluationPlays a role in the accounts leadership team, communicating across technical and delivery towers, in support of the Account Executive's ability to deliver on the contract requirements. Required Technical and Professional Expertise Ability to work on site in Santa Fe, NM 5 days a week3-5+ years of experience with Medicaid10+ years experience as business analyst for data warehouse OR business intelligence projects.Experience with large scale system development.Demonstrated ability to understand industry issues and problems, relate them to clients' needs, and propose appropriate solutionsExcellent organization skills, ability to take initiative and work independently or as a member of a small team.Excellent interpersonal skills and relationship building, ability to collaborate and build consensusDesire to continue learning more about healthcare and the technologies supporting healthcare dataStrong presenter, comfortable presenting in front of customers, conveying status, answering Q&ADemonstrated ability to convey complex ideas in an easily understood manner to guide audience through written or verbal communications Preferred Tech and Prof Experience PREFERRED Skills and Experience:Previous experience as a business analyst working with software developersKnowledgeable in technology, specifically data warehousingCompetent in at least one BI technology (e.g. Cognos, Business Objects, Tableau)Competent in at least one analytics technology (e.g. SAS, R, SPSS)Competent in at least on geospatial technology (e.g. mapinfo, ESRI)Understanding of both technical and business process MITA requirements EO Statement  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Name: Entry level business analyst
Description: We are looking for candidates who are interested to work in the following domainRetailE-commerceBankingAutomotiveHealthcareFinanceAirlinesHospitalityJob Description Entry level jobs are available to those candidates with little or no experience. Such positions provide training and the prospect of future advancement. Entry-level business analysts work under supervision and perform a variety of tasks including developing and maintaining various databases, generating reports, and receiving continuous training while working on a variety of projects.  The primary responsibility of an entry-level business analyst includes supporting data gathering and providing review and analysis of data. Other day-to-day duties include ensuring data integrity, participating in data quality control and validation, and producing requirements documents for various business development activities. An entry-level business analyst may also create and execute test scripts under supervision. Principle Duties and Responsibilities: Interacts regularly and directly with the Operations function and has close user working relationship to ensure industry and best practices are employedDevelops intimate knowledge of business strategy, business model, and processes in order to identify improvement opportunities and value-added capabilitiesAssists with the implementation of Oracle's eBusiness Suite modulesProvides end-user support to a diverse, non IT-technical user baseLiaises with various business groups and users to understand and analyze business problems in an effort to lead toward viable solutions Qualifications Education Qualification  Masters' from a reputed University (Preferred).  Bachelor's is Mandatory.  Excellent Written and verbal communication skills

Name: Business Analyst 3
Description: MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS/EDUCATION /TRAINING REQUIRED: Experience upgrading prior versions of Office to Office 365 as a Business Analyst. PREFERRED: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field. 5+ years of experience as a business analyst in support of business and technology projects with a strong preference for experience supporting child welfare services. Preferred character traits include: very strong customer focus, listening skills, oral and written communication skills; excellent judgment in ambiguous situations; proven ability to facilitate collaboration within cross-functional teams; well organized, and self-motivated. Preferred experience includes: creating business case documents, documenting requirements, developing business models (ex. entity/class diagrams, activity/process diagrams, state diagrams, conceptual models, RACI matrices, role/responsibility matrices, etc.), analyzing gaps between present and future states, reengineering business processes, making presentations to business teams and executive management, and generating work estimates. Preferred knowledge includes: SharePoint, PowerPoint, cloud-based solutions, packaged software implementation, computing infrastructure, agile and iterative system engineering processes, government operations, and Business Analyst Book of Knowledge (BABOK). International Institute of Business Analyst (IIBA) Certification. Need a valid driver's license and ability to drive when needed. PURPOSE: The employee shall provide expertise regarding FCCS business operations, collaborate with cross-functional teams to explore business process improvement opportunities, and shall model both present and future state business operations using various industry-standard modelling and analysis techniques in order to help move from the present to the future state. 1) The employee shall participate in agency projects by analyzing business processes, eliciting and documenting project requirements, ensuring requirements traceability throughout all project work products and project phases, contributing to test and implementation plans, and participating in system testing, user acceptance testing, and implementation. To achieve these ends, the employee shall facilitate meetings with customers and service delivery staff. 2) The employee shall also provide ongoing customer support for custom and packaged software solutions. 3) The employee shall also help improve the agency’s business analysis procedures, standards, and project performance reporting. 4) The employee shall also help research new technologies, methodologies, and operating models to more quickly and efficiently achieve these objectives. The employee will help the agency achieve Child and Family Services Review (CFSR) standards and help ensure service delivery that focuses on Safety, Permanency and Well-being for the families served by the agency. The employee is committed to practicing cultural competence by: working respectfully and effectively with people of all cultures, classes, races, genders, ethnic backgrounds, religions, sexual orientations, mental and physical abilities, ages and appearances in a manner that recognizes, affirms and values the worth of individuals, families and communities and protects and preserves the dignity of each. The employee will adhere to the agency’s Guiding Principles by serving as a child welfare professional, valuing every child, honoring families, and valuing partnerships. JOB DUTIES: 85% The employee shall participate in the Office 365 Implementation project by analyzing business processes, eliciting and documenting project requirements, ensuring requirements traceability throughout all project work products and project phases, contributing to test and implementation plans, and participating in system testing, user acceptance testing, and implementation. 5% Help improve the agency’s business analysis procedures, standards, and project performance reporting. 5% Research new technologies, methodologies, and operating models to more quickly and efficiently achieve these objectives. 5% Perform other duties as assigned. *Position is subject to call-in during non-working hours as necessary* - provided by DiceSharePoint, PowerPoint, cloud based solutions

Name: Jr. Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionJob Summary: Looking for high powered and quantitatively oriented IT Business Analyst to support the Projects in IT Domain. Analyst will be required to analyze specific business problems and drive value in strategic areas of business. What you will get to do:Typically the customers would be Senior Managers / Directors from different Domains located in US, Latin America, and Asia Pacific.The analyst would typically handle a high impact project at any time which should result in bottom line impact.Most of the work would be around business understanding, data understanding, guiding junior analysts in data preparation, working with the statistical team to create models if required and result presentation.The analyst would be required to understand the business model, business brief, and the information available for analysis.Adhoc requirements would need to be fulfilled from time to time as well.High Level of Business analysis skills is necessary.Graduate or Post Graduate from Tier 1 with 0-2 years of experienceIdeal candidate would have strong analytical skills, ability to understand business situations and provide data backed analysis.Basic Requirement:Graduate degree in Computer Science.Must have completed Masters Degree in Computer Science.Experience in preparing basic flow diagrams, swim-lane diagrams.

Name: Sr. Business System Analyst
Description: Detailed Description: Collaborate with product team members, technology team, and User Experience Group to elicit/author scope documentation, project requirements, and Product Backlog Items (PBIs)  Review and Approve Project Scope, Requirements, Wireframes, Mockups, Content Matrix and Test Plan.  Attend Project Status meetings for assigned projects.  Work closely with Project Managers and App. Development Managers to formulate target delivery dates for the Scope Document (as applicable), Requirements Doc, and PBI deliverables and then deliver according to the planned schedule.  Facilitate PBI review and estimation sessions with the project team.  Support the development and test teams by providing requirements clarification, issue resolution, and process improvement in order to ensure the delivered product is functioning accurately and within the defined business objectives.  Support production support team by analyzing production issues, defining requirements..  Attend Stand-Ups, Sprint Planning, Amigo Review, Sprint Review, Retrospectives.  Create Process Flow Diagrams, Data Requirements modeling & Requirements Traceability Matrix as needed. Basic Qualifications: 5-7 years of experience in business and IT requirements analysis, detailed documentation and requirements management  Must have experience working on B2C customer facing web and mobile applications projects  Must have experience working on a front end application development team.  Must work effectively in a team environment and possess strong commitment to the team and the client.  Bachelor's Degree Preferred Qualifications: Experience with hybrid Agile/Waterfall methodologies preferred.  Excellent analytical skills with knowledge of front end web application development and IT architecture.  Experience with use case/software development tools (MS-Team Foundation Server).  Knowledge of writing/understanding detailed Use Cases and/or use of Gherkin.

Name: Senior Technical Business Analyst
Description: When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co., youre not just working at a global financial institution. Youre an integral part of one of the worlds biggest tech companies. In 14 technology hubs worldwide, our team of 40,000+ technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $9.5B+ annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that will not only transform the financial services industry, but also change the world.  At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of every employee, and were building a technology organization that thrives on diversity. We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation. If youre looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you.  Our Asset and Wealth Management division is driven by innovators like you who are driven to create technology solutions that make us work more efficiently and help our businesses grow. Its our mission to efficiently take care of our clients wealth, helping them get, and remain properly invested. Across 27 cities, our team of 4,600 agile technologists thrive in a cloud-native environment that values continuous learning using a data-centric approach in developing innovative technology solutions.  The Asset Management business is a leader across a broad range of core and alternative strategies, comprised of 1,300 investment professionals providing more than 350 different strategies spanning the full spectrum of asset classes, including equity, fixed income, cash liquidity, currency, real estate, hedge funds and private equity.  As the Technical Business Analyst, you will serve as the primary liaison between the business and technology; work with the business to analyze business requirements and review/produce documented and approved specification for any new/change to technology applications; work with the Quality Assurance Team and Development Team to ensure that they understand the specifications to deliver a quality product to the business; work with the training team to document system scenarios, identify roles impacted, and help develop a change management/training plan; and conduct business process modeling and generate applicable scenarios for the technology functionality testing team. Key Responsibilities: Analyzes business requirements to understand the business needs and to determine how systems and applications can best functionally fulfil those needs.Combines knowledge of what the business wants with knowledge of how the systems are built and used to create functional design and write user stories for a given application.Serve as the primary liaison between the Business, Architecture, Development and Testing teams throughout the project life cycle.Strategizes with the business for the optimization of system processes; Identify efficiencies and ways to improve BAU design and system flow.Responsible for the development and maintenance of detailed project plan for all technology deliverables.Identifies, assesses, and documents business requirements, recommending business priorities, and advising business on options, risks, and costs.Schedule and lead requirements & JAD sessions with stakeholders; gather testable system requirements and translate them into use cases in user stories & gherkin.Analyzes impact of proposed solution across the business and develops use cases to demonstrate the business requirements to the technology teams. The successful candidate will be a demonstrated leader with a proactive, hands-on management approach and strong operational skills: 10 + years of experience in information technology with an emphasis on Technical Business Systems Analysis.Demonstrated ability with gathering and analyzing Business and Data Requirements across multiple applications and technologies throughout the full SDLC of projects.Self-starter who with a proven track record in analytical thinking, problem solving and communication and experience in dealing with both senior executives and their teamsStyle that promotes a culture of collaboration and teamwork.Strong written and verbal communication skills combined with solid project management ability.Ability to manage to tight deadlines with a mind-set for flexibility.Preferred Skills: Advanced knowledge in Agile SDLC.Knowledge of BDD/TDD.Prior experience in financial / banking institutions and knowledge of various financial business processes.Experience/understanding of business process reengineering and business modeling concepts, business systems development and analysis.

Name: Business Analyst
Description: At Updox, a Business Analyst is responsible for working with customers (internal and external) to develop solutions to challenging business problems and opportunities. The Business Analyst works with the customer to fully flesh out ideas, helping them to understand key business integration points as well as any tradeoffs that may exist. The Business Analyst works to translate the customers requirements into Agile story form for implementation by our development team. Finally, the Business Analyst acts as a subject matter expert throughout a project to ensure that any questions from the technical or customer teams are answered in a timely fashion. What you'll do... Acts as a liaison between sales, business development, product management, the customer and the development team Understands and complies with business processes and procedures Information gathering Conducting market and product research Analyzing business needs Crafting solutions to interesting business challenges Developing requirements Creating and maintaining project documentation Coordinating the development and quality assurance, review and updating of procedures, training and communicationsEssential Job Functions Problem Solving/Brainstorming/Facilitating Requirements Definition/Agile Story Writing Meetings/Presentations/Demos Interface Prototyping/MockingWhat you'll bring... Electronic Health Record (EHR) or Pharmacy Management System (PMS) experience would help bring your resume to the top of the list 5+ years as a Business Analyst or equivalent experience working in the healthcare information systems and/ or Saas-based software industry Ability to determine target audience and create communications that are clear, concise and understandable Ability to establish strong working relationships with internal and external associates Experience working on agile teams is preferred Must have strong verbal and written communication skills Requires the ability to work in a rapidly changing environment Must have a passion to learn new things and problem solve Familiar with using JIRA and being an advocate for Agile software development practices Some travel is requiredPlease note this is not a remote position. All candidates must be able to work in the Dublin, OH office.

Name: Business Analyst, Lead
Description: Job Description:This position is responsible for identifying, defining, planning, coordinating, and executing requirements of information systems of various size and complexity. Under general direction, leads project scoping and helps mature agile practices on multiple projects concurrently. As an experienced agile and SDLC professional, the ideal candidate will help define and continuously improve project initiation and the requirements discipline. Is expected to troubleshoot existing system logic difficulties and documentation as necessary. Should have experience and ability to support, large, complex, cross organizational projects and programs from inception through operations. Strong in building relationships with key stakeholders including senior business and IT leadership. Will be responsible for leading and mentoring junior team members and is expected to operate in both a team and individual environment. Standards - Expected to develop and maintain standards, tools, techniques and processes applicable to the analysis and documentation required of the business analyst group. This would include contributing to application/solution development lifecycle process improvements as well as processes and documentation. Advocates and implements agile maturity standards across the board Business Process Analysis -- Ability to identify businesses strengths and weaknesses and suggests areas of improvement. Understand and recommend modifications to business processes addressing complex business issues as the business and systems evolve. Coaching - Will mentor and coach team members. Required to review and provide feedback on specifications, requirements and process flows. Travel & Work Hours - Occasional travel (domestic or international) between operating companies may be required. Work during nonstandard hours may be required.  30%: Process Management - Assists in defining SDLC processes, metrics, agile best practices, standard work, project scope, project plans, dependency matrix, and issue resolution with the management team. Guides the technology team and other business analysts regarding implementation and documentation of projects, processes, methodologies and engineering techniques. Provides leadership and management including delegation, mentoring, and coaching. Identify risks and mitigation strategies  20%: Continuous Improvement - Measures the effectiveness and seeks to continually improve the quality of processes. Includes processes, practices and standards to be implemented in the business analyst community. Lead the center of excellence and implement ideas and solutions to improve effectiveness and efficiency.  20%: Strategist - Develop long-term strategies for improved operational processes and system functionality.  20%: Analyst - Performs and manages project scoping. Consistently demonstrate thorough understanding of high-level business processes. Identify and present opportunities, alternatives and recommendations to business and IT leadership.  10%: Relationship building - Acts as an ambassador and liaison for Technology Services. Develops relationships with customers by being proactive, displaying a high-level of knowledge of the business and providing innovative business solutions. Must be able to drive prioritization conversations and negotiations with the business partners and solution providersRequirements:Education Level: Bachelor's Degree. Masters preferred. Course of Study/Major: Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or other Technology-related fields such as Aviation Related Work Experience: 10+ years Requirements:Demonstrated mastery of software development lifecycle management including formal requirements and analysis methodologies documentation techniques such as use cases, business rules, impact analysis, process diagrams, etc.Requires ability to establish standards and guidelines for analytical processes and documentation from development through adoption.Expert analytical and problem-solving skills. Must be able to identify the best solution leveraging custom applications and Platform Solutions (Example: SAP, SalesForce, etc) that are cost effectiveRequires ability to understand existing business processes and suggest improvements where necessaryRequires ability to multi-task across multiple large, cross-departmental, complex projects and/or initiatives understanding priority and competing needs with minimal direction from management.Requires excellent verbal and written communication skills, people skills, negotiation, coordination, planning, presentation skills, facilitation skillsRequires a demonstrated success in navigating a complex organizational structure.Seven or more years of experience in scoping, analysis and requirements gathering for large, complex software projects.Demonstrated ability in metrics driven continuous improvement initiativesExperienced in facilitating meaningful conversations with business and IT stakeholders, and can build consensusSkilled in coaching and mentoring team members.Experience in Use Case analysis and modeling, and other industry best practices.Drive SDLC and agile maturity within the organizationExperience in effectively partnering and negotiating with vendors and solution providers

Name: Diversity Business Analyst- Diversity Business Analyst Senior
Description: TitleDiversity Business Analyst- Diversity Business Analyst Senior28-Nov-2018Job DescriptionThis position is posted in a range from Diversity Business Analyst to an Diversity Business Analyst Senior. *Note: Education and/or experience will be used to determine the appropriate salary and salary grade level. Position SummaryAs an integral part of the Diversity & Inclusion team, the Diversity Business Analyst will be responsible for conducting statistical analysis including descriptive and predictive modeling to advance diversity strategic objectives. The Analyst will also be responsible for developing, monitoring, & disseminating EEO, affirmative action, & other federal/state legally mandated analyses/reports. This role plays a key part in analyzing and summarizing data to tell a story regarding the current and future state of workforce demographics.Principle AccountabilitiesCreate and maintain enterprise/business unit Diversity & Inclusion scorecards, dashboards, heat maps, and interactive reports to identify trends, root cause and actionable insights.Develop visualizations that properly convey insights derived from data analyses.Interpret and present analytical data to executives and other key stakeholders.Develop, maintain, and analyze spreadsheets and databases extracting current and historical workforce data from multiple systems.Use workforce demographic data to investigate potential correlation between hiring, promotion and other decisions and the advancement of diversity program objectives. Retrieve, compile, analyze, and visualize data for legally required AA/EO reports in accordance with federal/state compliance regulations; compile/complete annual VETS 4212 report in compliance with related requirements.Conduct adverse impact analyses and other statistical analyses for annual Affirmative Action plans; develop methodology and provide data reports to periodically monitor progress toward goals & analyze/identify trends.Conduct pay equity study to identify potential risks.Develop key performance indicators and metrics to measure the effectiveness of diversity and inclusion initiatives, i.e., education and awareness; Employee Resource Groups; etc.Oversee the completion of diversity related benchmark surveys, i.e., Human Rights Campaign, Disability Equality Index, etc.Prepare standard and ad-hoc reports to monitor trends in hiring, promotion, performance ratings, termination, etc.Auto req ID19769BRRelocationNo LocationColumbus, OH Job TypeFull-Time Job CategoryHuman Resources/Recruiting/Training Minimum RequirementsWorkforce Diversity Data Analyst:Education  :Bachelor’s degree Experience: Minimum of 3 years in Business Analytics or Human Resources related function. Minimum of 3 years conducting complex statistical analysis, projections, and trends. Working with business intelligence solutions, delivering metrics, dashboards, etc. Workforce Diversity Data Analyst Senior:Education  :Bachelor’s degree Experience: Minimum of 6 years in Business Analytics or Human Resources related function. Minimum of 6 years conducting complex statistical analysis, projections, and trends. Working with business intelligence solutions, delivering metrics, dashboards, etc. Requirements- Other / Preferred Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree Statistics, Math, Human Resources or related field.Minimum of 3-6 years in Diversity, Inclusion, Equity, Compliance or related function.Experience with various Human Capitol systems, i.e., PeopleSoft, Kenexa, Oracle, etc.Delivering innovative solutions in support of Diversity and Inclusion strategies.Knowledge and SkillsExcellent written and verbal communication skills.Demonstrated project management skills.Ability to translate advanced data analysis techniques into common concepts.Excellent facilitation and presentation skills.Demonstrated conceptual & critical thinking skills.Ability to develop research questions and research design.Proficiency in statistical software (R, Python, SAS) and MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint).Proficiency with a visualization tool (Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI)

Name: Business Analyst- JDEdwards Finance
Description: We are dedicated to the belief that people are our most important asset. In filling job openings every effort is expended to find candidates within Worthington, its divisions or subsidiaries. Employee development, opportunity to grow and continuing to evolve both as an employee and as a company are instrumental to our success. We encourage employees to inquire about open positions and apply to those that help further their career goals. SummaryWorthington Industries is looking for an entry level JDEdwards Business Analyst. This person is responsible for supporting and improving how the organization utilizes JDE EnterpriseOne software. This includes production system issue resolution, trouble-shooting, and training. Also includes the analysis of business requirements, developing alternatives for improvement, creating formal system requests (as required), testing, documenting, and implementation planning. Plays a role in the implementation of JDE for new acquisitions, and additional applications/systems.This person should have a basic knowledge of JDE applications, and will be trained on Worthington Industries’ specific requirements and initiatives. This position comes with the opportunity to travel domestically and internationally.ResponsibilitiesHas a basic knowledge of JDE functional applications supported: (Manufacturing, Distribution, with an emphasis on Finance & Accounting) Current functionality, planned functionality, pain-points, workarounds, impacts, timetables, etc.Manages the research, resolution, escalation and prioritization of business issues.Meets with business partners, stakeholders, and solution leads to understand current system needs, future goals, and help to establish realistic timetables for completion.Facilitates and executes efforts related to system configuration changes (set-up, testing, compliance, and analysis of results).Develops necessary documentation associated with recommended business system changes.Meets with internal IT staff to communicate/educate the business’ desired system changes.Willingness to travel.Other duties as assigned.Desired ExperienceAbility to work effectively with cross functional departments Detail and process orientedFlexible and adaptable to changeSelf-motivated and possesses the ability to complete tasks on time and with little supervisionVery good problem solving skillsMust have above average written, verbal communication skillsExcellent organizational skillsEducationBachelors in Business or Information Systems Bachelors or equivalent in Accounting or Finance Worthington Industries Inc., and its subsidiaries, is an equal employment opportunity employer. Qualified applicants are considered regardless of race, color, religion, age, national origin, sex, disability or veteran’s status.

Name: Business Systems Analyst I
Description: JPMorgan Chase& Co. is a leading global financial services firm with assets of $1.1 trillion and operations in more than 50 countries. The firm is a leader in investment banking; financial services for consumers and businesses, financial transaction processing, asset and wealth management, and private equity. Under the JPMorgan Chase & Co. brand, the firm serves millions of consumers in the United States and many of the world’s most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients. The Business Systems Analyst I is responsible for working with the business to gather reporting and data requirements, perform the functional and technical design, and scope level of effort needed to deliver solutions to business users. Name: Business Analyst 3/BA3
Description: Business Analyst 3/BA3 Business Analyst for the upgrade of our current Office 2013 environment to Office 365. PURPOSE: The employee shall provide expertise regarding FCCS business operations, collaborate with cross-functional teams to explore business process improvement opportunities, and shall model both present and future state business operations using various industry-standard modelling and analysis techniques in order to help move from the present to the future state. The employee shall participate in agency projects by analyzing business processes, eliciting and documenting project requirements, ensuring requirements traceability throughout all project work products and project phases, contributing to test and implementation plans, and participating in system testing, user acceptance testing, and implementation. To achieve these ends, the employee shall facilitate meetings with customers and service delivery staff.The employee shall also provide ongoing customer support for custom and packaged software solutions.The employee shall also help improve the agencys business analysis procedures, standards, and project performance reporting.The employee shall also help research new technologies, methodologies, and operating models to more quickly and efficiently achieve these objectives. The employee will help the agency achieve Child and Family Services Review (CFSR) standards and help ensure service delivery that focuses on Safety, Permanency and Well-being for the families served by the agency. The employee is committed to practicing cultural competence by: working respectfully and effectively with people of all cultures, classes, races, genders, ethnic backgrounds, religions, sexual orientations, mental and physical abilities, ages and appearances in a manner that recognizes, affirms and values the worth of individuals, families and communities and protects and preserves the dignity of each. The employee will adhere to the agencys Guiding Principles by serving as a child welfare professional, valuing every child, honoring families, and valuing partnerships.MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS/EDUCATION /TRAINING REQUIRED:5 years experience as a Management Analyst 1 / Business Analyst or completion of undergraduate major program core course work in business administration, management science, or public administration.3 years of experience in research & analysis and written documentation of findings.PREFERRED: Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or related field. 5+ years of experience as a business analyst in support of business and technology projects with a strong preference for experience supporting child welfare services. Experience upgrading prior versions of Office to Office 365. Preferred character traits include: very strong customer focus, listening skills, oral and written communication skills; excellent judgment in ambiguous situations; proven ability to facilitate collaboration within cross-functional teams; well organized, and self-motivated. Preferred experience includes: creating business case documents, documenting requirements, developing business models (ex. entity/class diagrams, activity/process diagrams, state diagrams, conceptual models, RACI matrices, role/responsibility matrices, etc.), analyzing gaps between present and future states, reengineering business processes, making presentations to business teams and executive management, and generating work estimates. Preferred knowledge includes: SharePoint, PowerPoint, cloud-based solutions, packaged software implementation, computing infrastructure, agile and iterative system engineering processes, government operations, and Business Analyst Book of Knowledge (BABOK). International Institute of Business Analyst (IIBA) Certification. Need a valid driver's license and ability to drive when needed.  Job Type: Full-time  Experience: Business Analysis: 3 years (Preferred) Work authorization: United States (Preferred)

Name: Business Analyst (Salesforce Service Cloud)
Description: Job DescriptionWe live in a moment of remarkable change and opportunity. Data and technology are transforming industries, society, and even the workplace by creating professions that did not exist before the emergence of data, cloud, social, and mobile technologies.  As the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, IBM is a leader in this global transformation and is just the place to continue your career. Network in an open, friendly and flexible work environment where diversity is embraced, while new and creative ways of thinking are encouraged and supported. As an IBMer, you can change the way the world works. Join this IBM team and be part of a diverse and global company of thinkers and doerspeople who want to make an impact, cultivate their expertise and collaborate with some of the worlds top business and technology professionals.  The Client Support IT team is looking for an experienced Business Analyst to join our high-performing application development team. Our portfolio of applications spans electronic support, call/problem management, and entitlement systems. We operate and transform the capabilities for IBM worldwide technical support which is key to IBMs growth.  IBM is focused on the client experience. A key measurement of client satisfaction is the Net Promoter Score (NPS). In this role, you will be responsible for driving NPS improvements for clients as well as IBM support professionals. Youll work with the support and transformation leadership teams to gather, analyze and drive change using client satisfaction data, direct client interaction, and executives from across the IBM support organization. Working with the development teams, you will develop actions to improve NPS scores and communicate the progress to executive leadership as well as the IBM support teams. This position will require the ability to work across management matrices and also leverages strong Agile and iteration management skills. Who you are:Self-motivated and self-managed with a demonstrated analytical ability and curiosityTakes creative approaches to problem solving, innovation, and issue resolutionWorks independently and within a team settingStrong oral and written communication skillsFluent in EnglishLive in or willing to move to Armonk NY, Austin TX, Littleton MA, or Raleigh NC to work collaboratively in the officeHow well help you grow:This role will give you executive visibility and the chance to show that you can drive impactful change. Offer an opportunity to be a part of a hardworking team in a collaborative, borderless organization in an inspiring, empowered environment Provide a place where youre proud to work and where you are motivated to produce the best results possible No remote opportunities exist  Must have the ability to work in the US without current/future need for IBM sponsorshipRequired Technical and Professional Expertise 10+ years of experience with IBM support or development processAbility to work with both the business and technical resources to understand and define functional/technical requirements Ability to use Agile collaboration tools (e.g. Mural, Slack, RTC, Trello)Working familiarity with Agile development conceptsMust have excellent communication skills Preferred Tech and Prof Experience Subject matter expert in Salesforce Service CloudFamiliarity with IBM brand and business structure EO Statement  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Name: Senior Software Quality Analyst
Description: Job Description:The Software Quality Analyst, Senior will work closely with business analysts and development teams to ensure applications meet business and technical requirements and are of high quality. The Software Quality Analyst, Senior will estimate, plan and perform software testing for projects of varying size and complexity. This position will develop a solid business and functional understanding of the system(s) under test and serve as a knowledge resource for team members.  50%: Create and maintain reusable test cases and execute tests using manual and automated tools.  30%: Analyze test results, document software defects, and validate defect fixes.  10%: Coordinate software testing for releases, prepare release testing status reports, and communicate test results and issues to interested stakeholders.  10%: Monitor project activities, assess quality risks, and recommend mitigation.Requirements:Education Level: Bachelor's Degree  Course of Study/Major: Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, or Business  Related Work Experience: 4-6 years 4+ years experience in software development, quality assurance, or management information systems.2+ years experience planning, estimating, and executing testing for large, complex multi-tier applications.Strong familiarity with software quality assurance processes, software testing best practices, quality metrics, and performance & automated testing tools.Must possess a team player attitude and be committed to promoting and fostering teamwork.Ability to translate business needs into test requirements.Excellent analytical and problem solving skills are needed to identify programming errors or inconsistencies.Strong interpersonal skills, including teamwork, facilitation, and negotiation.Detail-oriented with an emphasis on delivering accurate, high-quality assignments and projects.Excellent written and verbal communications skills.Organized and capable of prioritizing and managing multiple concurrent assignments.NetJets is a 24x7x365 operation. Job will require evening/weekend work to meet project deliverables.

Name: Finance Business Analyst

As well as establish and track project plans by sequencing project elements; determining time frames; staffing; tracking activity; resolving problems; recommending actions and publishing results. Name: JD Edwards Business Analyst
Description: JD Edwards Business Analyst . Summary  The JD Edwards Business Analyst is responsible for the full cycle of the implementation process for JD Edwards Order to Cash. This will include providing detailed business requirements and specifications for developers; processing definition outlines and flows; and maintaining and updating application specific documentation. The Analyst will assist in the development, coordination and implementation plans to test business and functional processes, and quality assurance testing as well as monitor and document post-implementation problems and revision requests. A successful candidate is a detailed oriented, problem solver with a desire to drive the business through a strong work ethic and understanding of the requirements and needs of the business.
