Name: Senior Operational Analyst - Optimization
Description: Job Description:The Operations Analyst, Senior is responsible to provide timely, relevant and accurate analysis of operational and business data and processes as needed. The Operations Analyst, Senior performs business and operational analysis to impact business results and support Senior Management decision making. The Operations Analyst, Senior investigates and understands diverse areas of the business and operation, supports Executive leadership initiatives and communicates findings effectively. The Operations Analyst, Senior prepares memos or presentations and delivers them directly to the Chief Executive Officer, Chief Financial Officer and other Executives of the organization. The Operations Analyst, Senior works with minimal supervision. The Operations Analyst, Senior provides leadership and direction on complex and diverse projects. The Operations Analyst, Senior may focus on a special area of expertise in statistics, analytics, and operations research.  80%: Performs analysis of both strategic and tactical business and operational questions working independently with reliance on creative analytical curiosity. Analysis of data involves highly complex business and operational modeling. Consultatively collaborates with business partners to analytically explore business and operational problems, develop models, visualize and understand operational issues. Develops reports and creates presentations for Executive leadership exploring business and operational opportunities and recommends solutions.  20%: Collaborate with, mentor, develop and support other analysts.Requirements: Education Level: Master's Degree (Ph.D. preferred)  Course of Study/Major: Operations Research, Economics, Engineering or related field. MBA, PHD in Operations Research, Analytics, Mathematics or similar discipline preferred.  Related Work Experience: 1-3 years Strong verbal and written presentation skills.Excellent analytical skills.Ability to understand and master new concepts quickly.Exceptional creative problem solving abilities.Detail oriented and proven ability to prioritize multiple objectives in a dynamic environment with constantly shifting priorities.Initiative, drive and confidence to achieve results without explicit direction or detailed instruction.Experience with Optimization/Simulation software such as SAS, ILOG, CPLEX, R, Python, etc.Interest and/or familiarity with aviation (commercial or private).

Name: Microsoft Dynamics CRM Business Analyst
Description: Job Description IBM Services is a team of business, strategy and technology consultants enabling enterprises to make smarter decisions and providing unparalleled client and consumer experiences in cognitive, data analytics, cloud technology and mobile app development. With global reach, outcome-focused methodologies and deep industry expertise, IBM empowers clients to digitally reinvent their business and get the competitive edge in the cognitive era in over 170 countries.Bottom line? We outthink ordinary. Discover what you can do at IBM.IBM Services is seeking Microsoft Dynamics Customer Relationship Management (CRM) Business Analysts to collect and analyze requirements and solve client problems using Microsoft Dynamics CRM solutions. You will serve as a liaison between clients and project consultants, particularly during initial project phases. You will work primarily on project execution but may be involved in sales support as well.  Microsoft CRM Business Analysts are responsible for identifying, developing and deploying end-user solutions in CRM systems. Using your deep functional knowledge and familiarity with the Microsoft Dynamics CRM application, you will ensure that client business requirements are met while providing a variety of advisory services around project management, business process development, implementation support and end-user training.Primary Responsibilities:Project ExecutionSupport the translation of client business requirements into CRM solutions, including requirements approval, communication, traceability and reuseContribute to the transfer of functional requirements to development and test teamsUse CRM workflow technology to automate business processesStay abreast on updates and new releases in CRM technologies (Microsofts and its competitors)Educate end-users on CRM functionsSales SupportHelp determine and translate customer needs into a solution and approachContribute to proposal developmentContribute to scope, approach, and estimating input to the proposal teamContribute to and participate in client demonstrations and presentationsAdditional skills required:Microsoft Office Suite, specifically Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and VisioTeam Foundation Server (TFS)Familiarity with Microsoft technologies/trendsStrong analytical, presentation, and writing skillsBENEFITS Health Insurance. Paid time off. Corporate Holidays. Sick leave. Family planning. Financial Guidance. Competitive 401K. Training and Learning. We continue to expand our benefits and programs, offering some of the best support, guidance and coverage for a diverse employee population. http://www-01.ibm.com/employment/us/benefits/https://www-03.ibm.com/press/us/en/pressrelease/50744.wssCAREER GROWTH Our goal is to be essential to the world, which starts with our people. Company wide we kicked off an internal talent strategy program called Go Organic. At our core, we are committed to believing and investing in our workforce through: Skill development: helping our employees grow their foundational skillsFinding the dream job at IBM: navigating our company with the potential for many careers by channeling an employees strengths and career aspirationsDiversity of people: Diversity of thought driving collective innovationCORPORATE CITIZENSHIP With an employee population of 375,000 in over 170 countries, amazingly we connect, collaborate, and care. IBMers drive a corporate culture of shared responsibility. We love grand challenges and everyday improvements for our company and for the world. We care about each other, our clients, and the communities we live, work, and play in!http://www.ibm.com/ibm/responsibility/initiatives.htmlhttp://www.ibm.com/ibm/responsibility/corporateservicecorps Candidates that live in or near one of the following cities preferred, but all candidates considered: Atlanta, Chicago, Columbus, Houston, Dallas, Raleigh, Washington DC Metro Area, Piscataway, Philadelphia. GBSEA17RWMS Required Technical and Professional Expertise At least 3 years team lead experience or management experience of 5+ team members (management consultant only)At least 2 years project experience in enterprise business application development and delivery (e.g., CRM, ERP, SCM, HCM)At least 1 year project implementation experience using Microsoft Dynamics 365, Microsoft Dynamics CRM online, or Microsoft Dynamics CRM 2016, 2015, or 2013At least 2 years project experience translating client business needs into software capabilitiesAt least 2 years project experience with business requirements analysis and modelingAt least 2 years project experience creating functional designs, test conditions and test scriptsAt least 2 years experience working within a team environmentBasic knowledge of software development methodologies (Waterfall and/or Agile) Preferred Tech and Prof Experience At least 2 years consulting experience working for a global systems integratorMicrosoft Certified Professional (MCP)At least 1 year project experience working with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Operations or Microsoft Dynamics AX 7, 2012, or 2009At least 1 year project experience working with global and offshore project teamsAt least 1 year experience with system integration or user acceptance testingAt least 1 year experience with organizational designAt least 1 year experience with business process design or re-engineeringAt least 1 year experience with developing and implementing end-user training programsAt least 1 year experience implementing or using CRM systems to support sales and marketing functionsAt least 1 year experience implementing or using CRM systems to support customer service, call center, or field service operations EO Statement  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Name: Senior Technical Business Analyst
Description: When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co., you’re not just working at a global financial institution. You’re an integral part of one of the world’s biggest tech companies. In 14 technology hubs worldwide, our team of 40,000 technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $9.5B annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that will not only transform the financial services industry, but also change the world.At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of every employee, and we’re building a technology organization that thrives on diversity. We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation. If you’re looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you. Our Asset and Wealth Management division is driven by innovators like you who are driven to create technology solutions that make us work more efficiently and help our businesses grow. It’s our mission to efficiently take care of our clients’ wealth, helping them get, and remain properly invested. Across 27 cities, our team of 4,600 agile technologists thrive in a cloud-native environment that values continuous learning using a data-centric approach in developing innovative technology solutions.The Asset Management business is a leader across a broad range of core and alternative strategies, comprised of 1,300 investment professionals providing more than 350 different strategies spanning the full spectrum of asset classes, including equity, fixed income, cash liquidity, currency, real estate, hedge funds and private equity.As the Technical Business Analyst, you will serve as the primary liaison between the business and technology; work with the business to analyze business requirements and review/produce documented and approved specification for any new/change to technology applications; work with the Quality Assurance Team and Development Team to ensure that they understand the specifications to deliver a quality product to the business; work with the training team to document system scenarios, identify roles impacted, and help develop a change management/training plan; and conduct business process modeling and generate applicable scenarios for the technology functionality testing team.Key Responsibilities:Analyzes business requirements to understand the business needs and to determine how systems and applications can best functionally fulfil those needs.Combines knowledge of what the business wants with knowledge of how the systems are built and used to create functional design and write user stories for a given application.Serve as the primary liaison between the Business, Architecture, Development and Testing teams throughout the project life cycle.Strategizes with the business for the optimization of system processes; Identify efficiencies and ways to improve BAU design and system flow.Responsible for the development and maintenance of detailed project plan for all technology deliverables.Identifies, assesses, and documents business requirements, recommending business priorities, and advising business on options, risks, and costs.Schedule and lead requirements & JAD sessions with stakeholders; gather testable system requirements and translate them into use cases in user stories & gherkin.Analyzes impact of proposed solution across the business and develops use cases to demonstrate the business requirements to the technology teams.The successful candidate will be a demonstrated leader with a proactive, hands-on management approach and strong operational skills:10 years of experience in information technology with an emphasis on Technical Business Systems Analysis.Demonstrated ability with gathering and analyzing Business and Data Requirements across multiple applications and technologies throughout the full SDLC of projects.Self-starter who with a proven track record in analytical thinking, problem solving and communication and experience in dealing with both senior executives and their teams Style that promotes a culture of collaboration and teamwork.Strong written and verbal communication skills combined with solid project management ability.Ability to manage to tight deadlines with a mind-set for flexibility. Preferred Skills: Advanced knowledge in Agile SDLC.Knowledge of BDD/TDD.Prior experience in financial / banking institutions and knowledge of various financial business processes.Experience/understanding of business process reengineering and business modeling concepts, business systems development and analysis.

Name: Salesforce Administrator / Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionPOSITION LOCATED IN OUR CORPORATE OFFICE IN COLUMBUS, OHIO A leading home improvement company like no other, we are seeking a truly unique and talented individual to take a hands-on leadership role on our IT team.  Based on our creation of Improveit! 360, a CRM built on the force.com (Salesforce) platform and designed specifically for remodelers, contractors and home services pros, we’re seeking someone who can help us continue to leverage this powerful tool in our highly successful business. We are seeking a dynamic, tech-savvy individual who can help us continue to shatter records and drive additional growth and operational efficiencies as a Salesforce Administrator, Business Analyst and IT guru. This is a dream role for someone who loves to be consistently challenged, enjoys a diverse range of job duties and has a passion for growing businesses and wowing customers. POSITION SUMMARY: As an IT professional with a strong salesforce background, you will be responsible for the Salesforce administration of Improveit 360 in our organization. A large portion of this role will be focusing on ways to enhance and extend its utilization to improve performance and efficiencies in key areas, including marketing, sales, and operations. The successful candidate will have a record of success in improving processes using Salesforce. If you have Salesforce developer experience and skills, all the better. We prefer to do as much internal development as possible. We’re looking for a unique, hands-on individual. If you can code, as well as perform the other requirements of this role, we are very interested in speaking with you.  From a business analyst perspective, the person in this role will spend a considerable portion of their time collaborating with Executive Leadership and Department Management to use technology and salesforce to move us forward. You will immerse yourself in the business, learning how things work, analyzing current processes with an eye toward aligning processes with technology to deliver the best customer experience, grow sales and improve profitability. You’ll evaluate and document business, departmental and user needs as functional requirements, and develop and deliver ideas and plans to meet those requirements. You’ll develop and execute what can be done in-house, and secure and manage any needed outside resources. You’ll see all outsourced work and projects through, from requirements documentation to development, testing, release and adoption.  Using your technical background, you’ll ensure our hybrid approach of in-house managed operations and outsourced IT solutions is the best for our size, operational requirements and current and future growth goals. You’ll manage resources that support our employees (end users) with the appropriate level of urgency and prioritization. KEY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:Salesforce AdministrationDaily administration and support of Improveit 360 (Salesforce application), including but not limited to customization of objects, creation of workflows, fields, page layouts and validations.Handles as much internal development, programming and customization internally, as feasible.Develops and creates advanced-level customized reports and dashboards.Logs, troubleshoots and tracks system problems through resolution.Manages Call Campaigns and working closely with Call Center Management to ensure continual optimization and ideal campaign water levels (call que volume).Handles and implements third-party integrations and trouble-shoots any issues with partner and applications as they arise.Collaborates with the Improveit! 360 product development teams to facilitate the addition of new features beneficial to our business.Business AnalystWorking with leadership and key departmental stakeholders, determine how Improveit 360 and other technologies, software, tools and approaches can improve operational efficiencies, enhance the customer experience and increase profitability.Uncovers areas of prime need and documents business requirements. Creates project and system enhancement proposals and plans based on observations, gaps and improvement opportunities and transfers business needs into Salesforce and other technology requirements.Handles all feasible development work in-house and manages all development projects and resources, ensuring what’s being built stays true to the original scope of work.Creates project and enhancement documentation, including user interface guides, training documentation or other functional specific documents and change orders.Validates test cases and results against requirements.Assesses the scope, impact, outcomes and results of projects, new functionality and new processes.Stays apprised of technology advances and salesforce features to create and maintain a future state roadmap that contains the target advancement needs of the business.IT Management:Manages the optimal approach to technology set-up and structure, including a mix of internally managed and externally-hosted solutionsEvaluates new hardware/software solutions considering business needs, growth opportunities and user requirementsHelps to support end-users through management of capable internal resource(s)Assists IT manager to handle the prioritization of user help requests according to a fair and equitable system aligned to business need and revenue goalsAssists IT manager to ensure all business data, systems, property, files and information is kept secure and a sound approach to backups and system fail-safes are in placeEnsures a sound hardware and software management, retirement and replacement system is in effect and is evaluated regularlySKILLS REQUIRED:Strong IT management skills, including the ability to manage a help-desk resource(s)Advanced Salesforce administration skillsExcellent project management skillsDemonstrated ability to meet deadlines, handle and prioritize simultaneous requests, and manage laterally and upwardsAnalytical thinker with strong problem-solving skillsExceptional verbal and written communication skillsExceptional ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organizationAbility to evaluate information gathered from multiple and differing sources, reconcile conflicts, break-down high-level, complex and/or technical information into user-friendly details and requirementsAbility to determine business requirements and turn them into Salesforce and technology requirementsAbility to assess the impact of new requirements on Salesforce and other technologies in use, as well as business operations in generalEXPERIENCE REQUIRED:Strong track record of successfully managing IT operations in the SMB spaceMinimum five years of experience as a Salesforce.com administratorcom Admin (ADM201 and ADM211) certifiedAPEX and Visual Force development experience, preferredSalesforce.com Developer certification, highly desiredProven ability to design and implement new processes and facilitate user adoption.Strong understanding of the platform, with the ability to build custom apps and objects, formula fields, workflows, custom views, and other content of intermediate complexityStrong understanding of Salesforce.com best practices and functionalityDocumented history of successfully driving projects to completionDemonstrated ability to understand and articulate complex requirementsPrevious experience working in a performance-driven environmentCOMPENSATION & BENEFITS:Highly competitive compensation package (base salary and incentive program)Generous time-off benefits, including company HolidaysHealth, Dental, Life insurance options401K Retirement SavingsAFLAC Supplemental InsuranceHigh level of autonomyAbility to work independentlyProfessional work environment, brand-new, centrally-located officesState-of-the-art technology tools and resourcesBacking of 30-year old proven Industry leaderCollaborative, driven, entrepreneurial environmentExecutive-level career advancement opportunity Company DescriptionBBB-accredited with an A+ Rating and Winners of 22 Consumers' Choice Awards, Improveit! is a nationally-recognized remodeling leader celebrating 29 years of success.Our unique culture of innovation and continual improvement nourishes the soil in which great careers flourish.

Name: Business Digital Technical Analyst Lead
Description: As a Business Technical Analyst Lead you will serve as the primary liaison between the IT and Digital product owners to analyze business requirements and review/produce documented and approved specifications for any new/change to technology applications; work with the Quality Assurance Team and Development Team to ensure that they understand the specifications to deliver a quality product to the business and generate applicable scenarios for the technology functionality testing team.  You will analyze the impact of proposed solutions holistically, develop use cases to explain/demonstrate business requirements/specifications to IT team, and contribute a business or process perspective during design reviews. You will be responsible for delivering various project related artifacts throughout the Software Development Lifecycle. You will assist the Quality Management Team to ensure that documented requirements and corresponding use cases / process flows can be easily translated into test plans and test cases, and ensure that the testing process covers all identified scenarios and use cases. You will triage defects and bugs related to assigned projects in a timely manner considering project timelines. You will facilitate implementation of new functionality into production and help triage any issues. Key Responsibilities:Analyzes business requirements to understand the business needs and to determine how systems and applications can best functionally fulfill those needsCombines knowledge of what the business wants with knowledge of how the systems are built and used to create a functional design and write user stories for a given applicationServe as the primary liaison between the Business, Architecture, Development and Testing teams throughout the project life cycleSchedule and lead requirements /JAD sessions with stakeholders; gather testable system requirements and translate them into use cases in Functional Specification Documents and user storiesConducts in-depth research to determine if solutions to business requirements currently exist within or outside the business unit, and if not, whether new effective solutions are feasibleAnalyzes impact of proposed solution to develop use cases to demonstrate the business requirements to the IT (Information Technology) Team and Quality Assurance TeamWork closely with the Integration System Test team to ensure all identified scenarios are properly tested and defects are resolved and a quality end user product is deliveredBachelors degree and 10+ years of Business Analyst work experienceMinimum 8+ years of experience in understanding business modeling concepts and business application developmentDemonstrated professional work experience in hand's on Application Development and/or Engineering roleMust have excellent communication, interpersonal, and analytical skillsMust have the ability easily assimilate information and learn new applications and processesDemonstrated experience in Agile SDLCAdvanced knowledge of Microsoft Office tools like MS Word, MS Excel, and MS PowerPointAdvanced knowledge of process flow charting tools like VisioMust have a solid ability to analyze complex system requirements and present findings to both internal and external stakeholders in a simple and comprehensible mannerMust have excellent writing skills, with solid experience in writing functionalMust have a good understanding of the defect management and resolution process using defect management tools like HP ALMMust have an excellent ability to multi-task effectively working on several projects synchronouslyPreferred Qualifications:Prior knowledge / experience using JIRA and Blueprint is a plusAdvanced knowledge in Agile SDLC is a plusPrior experience in Cyber Security is a definite plusPrior experience in financial / banking institutions is a plus

Description: Must be willing to relocate MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS/EDUCATION /TRAINING REQUIRED:Experience upgrading prior versions of Office to Office 365 as a Business Analyst.- MUST HAVEPREFERRED:Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field. 5+ years of experience as a business analyst in support of business and technology projects with a strong preference for experience supporting child welfare services. Preferred character traits include: very strong customer focus, listening skills, oral and written communication skills; excellent judgment in ambiguous situations; proven ability to facilitate collaboration within cross-functional teams; well organized, and self-motivated. Preferred experience includes: creating business case documents, documenting requirements, developing business models (ex. entity/class diagrams, activity/process diagrams, state diagrams, conceptual models, RACI matrices, role/responsibility matrices, etc.), analyzing gaps between present and future states, reengineering business processes, making presentations to business teams and executive management, and generating work estimates. Preferred knowledge includes: SharePoint, PowerPoint, cloud-based solutions, packaged software implementation, computing infrastructure, agile and iterative system engineering processes, government operations, and Business Analyst Book of Knowledge (BABOK). International Institute of Business Analyst (IIBA) Certification. Need a valid driver's license and ability to drive when needed.PURPOSE:The employee shall provide expertise regarding FCCS business operations, collaborate with cross-functional teams to explore business process improvement opportunities, and shall model both present and future state business operations using various industry-standard modelling and analysis techniques in order to help move from the present to the future state. 1) The employee shall participate in agency projects by analyzing business processes, eliciting and documenting project requirements, ensuring requirements traceability throughout all project work products and project phases, contributing to test and implementation plans, and participating in system testing, user acceptance testing, and implementation. To achieve these ends, the employee shall facilitate meetings with customers and service delivery staff. 2) The employee shall also provide ongoing customer support for custom and packaged software solutions. 3) The employee shall also help improve the agency’s business analysis procedures, standards, and project performance reporting. 4) The employee shall also help research new technologies, methodologies, and operating models to more quickly and efficiently achieve these objectives. The employee will help the agency achieve Child and Family Services Review (CFSR) standards and help ensure service delivery that focuses on Safety, Permanency and Well-being for the families served by the agency. The employee is committed to practicing cultural competence by: working respectfully and effectively with people of all cultures, classes, races, genders, ethnic

Name: Senior Business Transformation Analyst
Company: Department of Administrative Services, State of Ohio
Description: MISSION STATEMENT: Atthe Ohio Office of Budget and Management, it is our mission to provide policyanalysis, fiscal research and financial management services to the Governor andagencies of state government, helping to ensure the proper and responsible useof state resources.  Asa cabinet-level agency within the executive branch of state government, OBMdevelops, coordinates and monitors the individual budgets of state agencies andreviews all financial transactions made with public funds. JOB DUTIES: Provides functional and technical guidance to businessowners, subject matter expert in technical and functional aspects of FinancialPeopleSoft applications of General Ledger (GL) module and Commitment Control inthe Ohio Administrative Knowledge System (OAKS) Financials Understands the integration of the GeneralLedger and Commitment Control, Budget & Planning (BPM), includingimplementing, supporting, maintaining, installing upgrades and applying newimages and fixes; responsible for all phases of project management for theOffice of Budget & Management for the Requirements and ConfigurationManagement team (RACM) as it related to the Budget & Planning; managesassigned projects related to financials & operating reporting; buildsPeopleSoft queries; provides functional support for BPM reporting from COGNOS; definesbusiness requirements (e.g., process improvement opportunities); drafts generaldesign documents (which includes: functional requirements, assumptions, testscenarios and conditions, process flows); analyzes and defines risks that mayaffect the project; defines specific activities to be performed to produceproject deliverables; ensures scheduled system time frames are met; logsCustomer Relationship Management (CRM) with the service provider & respondsto inquiries; coordinates with OBM budget and IT for ETLs from EPM to PatternStream; coordinates with developers to resolve technical & functionalissues in OAKS Financials; reports delivery problems; analyzes & enterssystem configuration; evaluates PUM implementation changes to OAKSfunctionality; provides regular progress reports to OBM and (Department ofAdministrative Services) DAS business owners; oversees delivery to enduser/client for operational use; acts as a representative of OBM in monitoring& resolving OAKS productions issues, defects & enhancements; acts aliaison with agencies in resolving issues related to the OAKS productionenvironment; creates new solutions to customize application for improvedbusiness processes; shares lessons learned with team members  Implement PeopleSoft technologies (e.g. Peopletools, PeopleCode, SQL, Application Designer, Application Messaging, reportingtools & configuration); prioritizes test plans & migration/releasemanagement schedules; oversees implementation of modifications or enhancementsto OAKS; conducts testing (e.g., System Accepting Testing (SAT), UserAcceptance Testing (UAT), & Operational Readiness Testing (ORT)) for newfunctionality; executes & evaluates test scenarios for complextechnical changes; develops test schedules; identifies problems found intesting & relays them to the service provider; executes regression testingin the OAKS test environment; coordinates system validation when upgradesand/or new images are applied; writes SQL and understands PeopleSoft tablestructures; assists in the review of detailed design documents &the estimation of high level enhancements to OAKS. Maintains documentation ofconfiguration, daily, weekly and monthly procedures in the RACM sharepoint.  Attends meetings, conferences, &/orworkshops on related topics; responds to inquiries from state agencies, boards& commissions; performs other related duties as assigned; serves as agencyrepresentative for project in public forums (e.g., focus groups, other stateagencies, county agencies, media, federal government, legislature); makesproject presentations to educate end users, serves as subject matter expert totraining team for development of end-user training documents.  Evaluates training needs associated with business transformation projectimplementation; participates as functional subject matter expert in thedevelopment of training plans; responds to inquiries from state agencies,boards, & commissions;Performs other related duties as assigned.  Completion of undergraduate core coursework in business administration, public administration, information systems, engineering or comparable field; 3 years experience in business process transformation, organizational design, strategic human capital management &/or business process reengineering; 12 mos. exp. in software design &/or development commensurate with position to be filled. Or equivalent of Minimum Class Qualifications For Employment noted above.SDL2017

Name: Cybersecurity Business Analyst
Description: The Information Risk Analyst is responsible for IT risk coverage for JPMorgan Chase's Corporate Technology line of business. The goal of this team is to consistently identify, assess, and manage technology risks across all environments. Where controls are not adequate, this team escalates those concerns and assists with driving improvements to the overall control environment. The team also serves the business in a consultative manner, providing guidance to the business on addressing identified technology risks.As an Information Risk Analyst, you will support the following activities for Corporate TechnologyCompliance ChecksContinuous monitory of data feed to IDCertReport exceptions to the application team and the TCOsReconciliation of Application Onboarding tasks Key Responsibilities:Assist with monitoring existing technology issues and actions and support the closure verification process Enforce compliance with Firm-wide risk reduction programs Assist with the quality assurance review of various control assessment programsDevelop scorecard to help Technology Controls Team manage its internal objectives BA/BS Degree or Equivalent Experience2-5 years of experience in IT and reportingProficient verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to effectively lead discussions and meetingsTechnical skills experience, including Business Analysis, performance metrics and reporting, and project managementYour expertise in cyber, combined with your desire to provide innovative security services, will be an asset to our Cybersecurity team. Help deliver high-quality security solutions across all our lines of business around the world by creating, designing, implementing, and maintaining next-level technology. The work you’ll do is vital, as it will protect over $18 trillion of assets under custody and $393 billion in deposits every day.When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Company, you're not just working at a global financial institution. You're an integral part of one of the world's biggest tech companies. In 14 technology hubs worldwide, our team of 40,000 technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $9.5B annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that will not only transform the financial services industry, but also change the world.At JPMorgan Chase & Company we value the unique skills of every employee, and we're building a technology organization that thrives on diversity. We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation. If you're looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies around the world, we want to meet you.

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Company: The Ohio State University Wexner Medical Center
Description: Job TitleBusiness Systems Analyst Job ID443720 LocationShared Services Full/Part TimeFull-Time DepartmentInformation Warehouse Shift1 Regular/TemporaryRegular FTE %100.00 Salary Range Min$54800.00 Salary Range Max$82200.00 Job Description  Business Systems Analyst (Job Opening 443720) - POSITION SUMMARY Under general supervision, formulates and defines systems scope and objectives through researches and fact-finding combined with an understanding of applicable business systems and industry requirements. With this knowledge, develops or modifies moderately complex information systems. Includes analysis of business and user needs, documenting requirements, and revising existing system logic difficulties as necessary. In consumer foods and beverages, its brands include Smucker's®, Folgers®, Jif®, Dunkin’ Donuts®, Crisco®, Café Bustelo®, R.W. Knudsen Family®, Sahale Snacks®, Smucker's® Uncrustables®, Robin Hood®, and Bick’s®. Name: Agile Business Analyst
Description: The online and mobile  channels for Chase currently support more than 32 million active customers; 9  million customers interact with us daily, making Chase the most visited banking  portal in the USA. Positioned within the Consumer and Community Banking line of  business, the Digital Technology team is responsible for setting and executing  strategies that align with business objectives and drive innovation across  Chase Online and Mobile, helping to establish the best Digital Banking customer  experience in the industry.  The  Business Analyst team within Digital Technology plays a pivotal role in  the success of the  organization, bridging the gap between the development, design and  product  management teams. The Scrum Business Systems Analyst is the heart of the  team, working closely with our technology partners to groom detailed  stories for our development teams to execute. The BA is team player,  problem  solver and detail-oriented person.  + Bachelors Degree or equivalent experience  + 5 plus years of hands on I.T. Business Analysis experience in cutting edge technologies  + Strong understanding of Java code  + Javascript and JIRA experience preferred  + Agile experience and Gherkin scripting  + Experience with running JAD sessions with product owners and scrum team  + SQL and database scripting experience  + Financial experience a plus  + Web Service protocols such as SOAP, XML, JSON and similar others  + Excellent communication and trouble shooting skills  Our  Consumer & Community Banking Group depends on innovators like you to serve  nearly 66 million consumers and over 4 million small businesses, municipalities  and non-profits. You?ll support the  delivery of award winning tools and services that cover everything from  personal and small business banking as well as lending, mortgages, credit  cards, payments, auto finance and investment advice. This group is also focused  on developing and delivering cutting edged mobile applications, digital  experiences and next generation banking technology solutions to better serve  our clients and customers.  When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Company, you're not  just working at a global financial institution. You're an integral part of one  of the world's biggest tech companies. In 14 technology hubs worldwide,  our team of 40,000 technologists design, build and deploy everything from  enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as  innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud  development. Our $9.5B+ annual investment in technology enables us to  hire people to create innovative solutions that will not only transform the  financial services industry, but also change the world.  At JPMorgan Chase & Company we value the unique skills  of every employee, and we're building a technology organization that thrives on  diversity. We encourage professional growth and career development, and  offer competitive benefits and compensation. If you're looking to build  your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that  impact the lives of people and companies around the world, we want to meet you.  JPMorgan Chase is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer Disability/Veteran.

For over 25 years we have been focused on providing direct service to customers with a philosophy of making insurance easy and affordable to every driver, no matter their situation.Position Overview:SafeAuto’s Data Team is at the forefront of making data a competitive advantage. This includes being a point of contact for business users.Analyze business requirements and work with production data to validate business requirementsMap business requirements to subject area model and to logical enterprise modelIdentify and document business and data transformation rulesEducate end users on EDW capabilities and overall functionality. Assist users in finding the right information and/or provide point of contact for feedback into the EDW Product backlogDesign access structures and classify business users by type. Develop access standards.Define and get agreement with business users on service-level agreementsPlan and execute user acceptance testingMaintain EDW data DictionaryRequirements:Bachelor’s degree in related field or equivalent work experienceAt least 3 years of experience as a Business AnalystExperience and good at conflict resolution and managing priority conflictsExperience in defining and documenting clear and elaborate functional requirementsExperience in translating functional requirements into technical specificationsExperience of working in complete Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC), Agile experience preferredExcellent written and verbal communicationPreferred Skills:Experience as Business Analyst in Enterprise Data Warehouse/Business Intelligence functionExperience with Microsoft BI stack (SQL Server, SSIS, SSAS, SSRS)Basic understanding of data warehouse design (Kimball and/or Inmon)Experience in project estimation techniques and cost-to-benefit analysisWhat you can expect from us:Competitive wagesComprehensive benefits package available from Day 1, including health, dental and vision coverage with wellness incentive programGenerous paid time off and paid holiday programOnsite wellness program with coaches available for personalized nutrition and fitness counseling and fitness classes at our beautiful Easton headquartersOnsite café with chef offering made to order breakfast and lunch (reasonable pricing, too)401K plan with company match and superior performance-based bonus structureA full-time career in a growing industry, with lots of opportunities for advancementCasual dress code – wear jeans every day!Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. (While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk, and reach with hands and arms. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 pounds).#cb

Name: Business Data Analyst - II
Description: Description: The Analyst on the Data Analytics team is responsible for analysis, insights, observations and decision support for our business leaders in Finance, Marketing, & Network. As a data analyst/scientist at Client, you'll create reports, visualization charts, and statistical models to identify trends which will improve revenue, profitability and customer experience.  The tools used to perform these advanced analytics functions will vary depending on the nature of the request, but will likely include various statistical packages such as SAS, R, and Python. Data resides across many systems and therefore experience in SQL (Teradata and/or Oracle) is required and Hadoop experience is preferred. Name: Business Analyst/Project Manager

The candidate must adapt and move at a fast pace to deliver successful solutions using a variety of technologies in varied development methodology processes. Duties and ResponsibilitiesWith input from the product manager, contribute to the vision of the product roadmap and actively participate in backlog refinement and release planning preparation.Ability to develop a project plan, identify key internal and/or external resources required to make the project successful, prepare detailed status reports.Direct and monitor project activity and oversee the creation of project documentation and work with business to identify and analyze the core project needs and deliverables.Coordinate and facilitate meetings and working session activities to identify project goals, schedule, impacted processes and procedures to foster cooperation and collaboration from the project team.Act as liaison among business and technical stakeholders to elicit, anticipate, translate, analyze, communicate and validate requirements for changes to business processes, policies, information, and information systems.Gather high-level customer business needs and translate them into functional requirements, use cases, workflow diagrams, wireframes, report mockups and other forms of documentation.Use requirements to influence design, review of test cases, process change requests, and manage project scope, acceptance, installation and deployment.Facilitate change management of requirements, determine schedule impacts, and manage a project log of risks, issues and decisions.Coordinate reviews and signoffs with stakeholders to ensure the documentation accurately portrays the business need including acceptance criteria. Conduct periodic process reviews to clarify and document work product.Work as part of a cross-functional team of developers, architects, and QA to develop and break down requirements into manageable user stories.Verification of user stories to ensure they meet acceptance criteria so that items can be released to production efficiently.Perform product demos as needed.Manage and ensure timelines throughout project plan, including sprint cycles to ensure project milestones are met and product delivered within agreed upon and acceptable time constraints.Facilitate user testing for technology requests.Prepare training plans, release notes, customer announcements, and other internal job aids to facilitate successful product deployments.Prepare and implement policies related to the operations of the IT Department.Perform other duties, special projects and overall support as assigned by VP, IT Governance.QualificationsBachelor’s degree in a technical discipline.Three to five years of hands-on experience as a Business Systems Analyst delivering cutting edge technology with an emphasis on new product development in a technical environment.Three years of experience in a scrum/agile environment; Name: Business Analyst Office
Description: Job DescriptionGoAhead Solutions has an immediate need for a Business Analyst in Columbus, OH. This would be a Twelve month contract to start out.  MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS/EDUCATION /TRAINING REQUIRED:  Experience upgrading prior versions of Office to Office 365 as a Business Analyst.  PURPOSE:  The employee shall provide expertise regarding FCCS business operations, collaborate with cross-functional teams to explore business process improvement opportunities, and shall model both present and future state business operations using various industry-standard modelling and analysis techniques in order to help move from the present to the future state.  PREFERRED:  Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field. 5+ years of experience as a business analyst in support of business and technology projects with a strong preference for experience supporting child welfare services. Preferred character traits include: very strong customer focus, listening skills, oral and written communication skills; excellent judgment in ambiguous situations; proven ability to facilitate collaboration within cross-functional teams; well organized, and self-motivated. Preferred experience includes: creating business case documents, documenting requirements, developing business models (ex. entity/class diagrams, activity/process diagrams, state diagrams, conceptual models, RACI matrices, role/responsibility matrices, etc.), analyzing gaps between present and future states, reengineering business processes, making presentations to business teams and executive management, and generating work estimates. Preferred knowledge includes: SharePoint, PowerPoint, cloud-based solutions, packaged software implementation, computing infrastructure, agile and iterative system engineering processes, government operations, and Business Analyst Book of Knowledge (BABOK). International Institute of Business Analyst (IIBA) Certification. Need a valid driver's license and ability to drive when needed.  Job Duties:  -80% The employee shall participate in the Office 365 Implementation project by analyzing business processes, eliciting and documenting project requirements, ensuring requirements traceability throughout all project work products and project phases, contributing to test and implementation plans, and participating in system testing, user acceptance testing, and implementation.  -5% Help improve the agency’s business analysis procedures, standards, and project performance reporting.  -5% Research new technologies, methodologies, and operating models to more quickly and efficiently achieve these objectives.  -5% Perform other duties as assigned.  *Position is subject to call-in during non-working hours as necessary*

Name: Operations Business Analyst - Collections & Recovery - Consumer Banking
Description: This is a Business Analyst role, supporting the Collections & Recovery business, with a focus on audit preparation, control and action plan management, analysis, continuous improvement and project management. This role is predominantly focused on operational improvement and enhanced controls in a customer contact environment.The Retail Operations Collections & Recovery organization is made up of approximately 500 associates in Columbus and Manila. Our focus is to help customers resolve overdrawn and negative balance accounts prior to those accounts charging off. Once the accounts have charged off, our focus is recovering money for the bank and helping customers make payment arrangements and open new accounts.The desired candidate will leverage control and action planning experience to drive a constant audit ready environment within the line of business. The candidate will utilize data analysis tools (SAS, SQL, TOAD, Tableau) to create improved processes and improved customer interaction tools. In this role, the ideal candidate will lead the business interaction model with internal audit teams, lead opening and closure of internal action plans, conduct business level testing to ensure highly controlled customer interaction processes, and create meaningful analyses, reports and presentations in support of Collections processes that may overlap multiple teams such as Fraud, Branch Operations, Retail Servicing, and Risk. Regular duties may include: quality review, process improvement, control reporting, complaint root cause analysis, presentation of findings, and/or a variety of other function specific purposes such as audit preparation, action plan management, as well as weekly and monthly metrics reporting. As a Business Analyst in Collections & Recovery you will:Oversee internal and external audit preparation and engagementCreate and manage action plans for all control related eventsDeliver enhanced control processesServe as a high level point of contact for branch and internal control partnersIdentify opportunities for improvement and/or automation. Lead operational readiness for large scale projects and process improvementsProduce monthly management-level Business reviews Conduct ad hoc analysis on production issues or anomalies. Automate manual processesRoot cause complex customer interaction scenarios to ensure optimal resolution Qualifications:Bachelor degree in Economics, Business Administration, or similar field along with 7+years of experience in supporting large Operational teams highly preferred. Ideal candidate will have 5 or more years of Business Audit Preparation and/or Project Management experience in financial services or similar fieldExperience managing internal and external audits including external regulatorsStrong analytical skills-- advanced Excel skills required, SAS and SQL experience preferred Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to interface with all staff, including senior management. Ability to develop and maintain strong team relationships. Organizational skills, detail-oriented, ability to multi-task and prioritize Experience with problem solving, issue resolution Operations management or process improvement experience a plus Technical curiosity, knowledge and experience required Strong relationship management, leadership, excellent communication and interpersonal skills with a focus on developing leadership at all levels.Proactive problem solver that works well independently and as a team player Strong business analysis, project management, and planning skills Ability to identify issues, work collaboratively to recommend and implement solutions Results and client focused with a sense of urgency Understanding of Program / Project management disciplines

Name: Business Analyst, Enterprise Application Delivery
Description: Business Analyst, Enterprise Application Delivery Columbus, OH, USAFull-timeCompany DescriptionAt Abercrombie & Fitch, quality is in our roots and we’re on a mission to honor this rich heritage. With an unwavering focus on our customer, we strive every day to deliver a unique and welcoming experience, whether in our stores or online. Our three global brands, Abercrombie & Fitch, abercrombie kids and Hollister Co., are the embodiment of our passion for the incredible product. At the heart of it all is our amazing 500-acre campus, nestled just outside of Columbus, Ohio. With an open workspace, inspiring views, and even a place to gather as a team around the fire pit, our Home Office fosters a diverse and inclusive culture that consistently seeks the input of our associates and focuses on the future. We are looking for leaders, visionaries, and creatives who are willing to roll up their sleeves and write the next chapter in our brand’s legacy. Job DescriptionInformation Technology at Abercrombie & Fitch is fundamental to designing, sourcing, developing, and delivering fashion-forward merchandise to our customers. We are committed to implementing new strategic and systematic approaches to generate dynamic technology solutions for our growing business.  The business analyst will work within the A&F Co. IT and business community to ensure systems meet the business requirements of the user community with an emphasis on Merchandising, Planning, Forecasting, Inventory Management, Supply Chain, Sourcing, and Corporate Applications.  The ideal candidate will coordinate and lead project team meetings, analyze IT and business processes, and help design and implement improvements for the organization.  A Business Analyst for A&F Co. is the primary resource responsible for organizing and driving requirements sessions to help facilitate the successful delivery of enterprise projects. He/she will document and manage requirements, as well as develop test cases and scenarios to validate that functionality meets requirements. Also responsible for delivering related project documentation including functional requirements, business, and technical use cases, performance metrics, and user acceptance test plans.  You must be comfortable working in a fast-paced and demanding environment, able to multi-task across several projects simultaneously, and possess strong interpersonal communication skills to be able to effectively communicate with technical and non-technical resources alike. What will you be doing?Drive, collaborate and lead user discovery sessions and project team meetings to gather and organize project business requirements and use cases on assigned projectsAnalyze and document both business processes and system enhancements that reduce expense and increase customer satisfaction through improvements in quality, efficiency, and communicationIdentify innovative solutions to improve cross-functional processes and operational efficiencyWork with project leaders, architects, and application teams to determine the right technical solutions that meet the business requirementsDesign, coordinate and execute application functional tests to ensure the fulfillment of business requirements and IT quality, architectural, and security standardsWork closely with the quality assurance team on the correct testing methodology/tools/reporting, focusing on requirements and user test methodologyServe as a technical writer on select projects.  This may include creating end-user help and/or user documentation or working with the IT teams to document IT architectures, process, standards, and strategiesWhat will you need to bring?Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, MIS/CIS, Engineering, or related field (required)3+  years experience as a Business Analyst, preferably with a minimum of 2 years in a retail environmentStrong Business Analyst skills – experience with process modeling, use case development and detailed requirements documentation, with expertise in the software development life cycle2+ experience on either the Functional/Business and/or Technical side of Merchandising, Planning, Forecasting, Inventory Management, Supply Chain, Sourcing or Corporate Applications is recommended to be able to quickly understand and evaluate the business processes and requirementsDemonstrated ability leading large groups of both business and technical resourcesStrong interpersonal skills including collaboration, facilitation, leadership, and negotiationExcellent written and verbal communication skills to facilitate cross-cultural communication between and among highly experienced business and IT associatesExcellent analytical skills with the ability to understand and effectively communicate complex business and technical processes, problems, and issuesExcellent planning and organizational skills; capable of multi-tasking across several projectsAbility to understand the long-term ("big picture") and short-term perspectives of situationsPersonal Attributes: Confident, Self-starter, Strong work ethic, Highly motivated, Sense of humor, A Winning 'Will-Do' attitude, Team oriented Additional InformationABERCROMBIE & FITCH CO. IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY / AFFIRMATIVE ACTION EMPLOYER © ABERCROMBIE & FITCH CO. 2012

Name: Business Operations Analyst I
Description: *_Business Operations Analyst I_***Job Description:** Centralized Transaction Operations (CTO), which is aligned under Consumer & Community Banking, provides a wide range of global operational support and services for retail, commercial, treasury, asset wealth management and credit card customers. CTO has approximately 4,500 employees. CTO is composed of six core operating functions; Banking Center Services, Centralized Support Services, Customer Fulfillment Services, Payment Services, Regulatory Control Operations and Service & Resolution. Within CTO, these groups are supported by Performance Consulting, Implementation Services and Communications groups.  Service & Resolution (S&R) performs a variety of operations functions that support individual and corporate customers' transactions and request fulfillment for financial and non-financial service interactions.  The Business Support and Analytics group primarily focuses on assisting S&R in measuring, reporting and improving their business performance and client profitability through data analysis, process improvement initiatives and strategic planning. This position will play a critical role in developing reporting and visualizations for operations areas within S&R. *Key Responsibilities include:** + Develop streamlined and automated reporting from various systems including the Integrated Customer Data Warehouse  + Create advanced data visualization including real time dashboards to enable monitoring and tactical execution of our key businesses  + Perform data analysis by mining information from various data sources and construction of that data into meaningful, actionable information  + Engage with the business, management and key stakeholders to drive the understanding and adoption of new tools.  + Identify areas of opportunity through rigorous analysis of key performance metrics/indicators for each unit of Operations.  + Develop reports and structure presentations to present key messages to senior management *Experience (required/preferred):**Required: + Bachelor?s degree in business, computer science, or related field  + Minimum 3-5 years experience in data mining or business intelligence  + Experience with data mining/gathering and manipulation  + Strong skills in Microsoft Office suite: Excel, Access, Word, Power Point  + Business intelligence software including one or more of the following: SAS, BRIO Intelligence, MS SQL Server and/or Business Objects  + SQL programming experience  + Tableau dashboard development  + Strong attention to detail Preferred: + Experience with Excel and Access modeling using VBA  + Statistical analysis background (Monte Carlo, ANOVA, Regression, Decision Tree, Predictive Modeling)  JPMorgan Chase is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer Disability/Veteran.

Name: Technical Business Analyst
Description: Job Description IBM HR is undergoing a huge transformation and we are looking for a Technical Business Analyst to join our Technology Transformation Team.  The team is driving innovation by bringing in best in class software systems as well as overseeing the build of innovative Watson powered AI solutions. The technology we bring are focused on enabling the talent, executive, and learning teams. Our goal is to have the highest performing workforce with the best skills aligned to the right roles at the right time.  You enjoy solving the toughest challenges and roadblocks and can also take responsibility independently. You work well under pressure and are able to keep deadlines in a changing working environment.  We are looking for a Technical Business Analyst to work with the business to help understand, and translate business needs into high level and granular technical requirements. The selected candidate will help facilitate build buy evaluations in partnership with the project management and product management team.  Work Location  Littleton OR Cambridge OR Raleigh  Required Technical and Professional Expertise 3+ years of experience creating and gathering requirements for enterprise level projects1+ year of experience supporting a software engineering team. Preferred Tech and Prof Experience Work closely with Product Manager, project manager, development organization and third party vendors.Create Business Definition or Business Requirements Document and Use CasesUtilize design thinking skills to help the business arrive at their desired requirements.Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needsSuccessfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneouslyStrong analytical skills including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements EO Statement  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Position: Senior Business Analyst Client / Program: DLA Location: Columbus, Ohio Duration: Full-Time Budget/Salary: DOE Information Technology Strategies, LLC . is a government IT solutions provider servicing commercial and government initiatives in various parts of the United States. We are currently seeking a Senior Business Analyst to work for our company. Lead Scope analysis and project planning Lead project communications throughout the lifecycle of a project Participate in project planning or oversight activities for assigned projects and initiatives. Creating and maintaining of project and systems documentation and artifacts to support established and future business applications throughout all phases of the software life-cycle. Develop process flow diagrams. Develop and document current and new processes. Prepare test plans consisting of test cases, and other documentation to support testing. Lead and conduct functional, regression, environment and accessibility testing. Oversee User Acceptance Testing (UAT). Document and track test results and track defects through resolution. Required 7-10yrs’+ experience in an I.T. environment with business analysis experience. Must haves strong working knowledge of various documentation styles – user guides, technical process flows, technical diagrams, process documentation, etc; Excellent verbal and written communications skills and organizational skills is a requirement. The ability to adapt quickly working in a challenging and fast paced environment with a team as well as individually is required. Proficiency in requirements development and have a solid understanding of software development. Well versed in Systems Development Lifecycle methodologies, i.e. WaterFall. Must be able to present system designs for user approval at formal reviews. Must be knowledgeable in life-cycle support, including maintenance, administration, and management. Must be able to provide solutions to identified software problem reports. Must be capable of performing configuration management, integrating software, interpreting software test results, and recommending solutions for unsatisfactory test results. Ability to translate high level business requirements into technical requirements Must have a strong documentations and technical writing experience Must be knowledgeable in performing requirements analysis for a wide range of user for office automation. Must be knowledgeable utilizing the BABOK guidelines such as agile, business architecture/ intelligence, information technology and business process management. Must have skills and knowledge utilizing: MS Windows, Microsoft Office Suite including MS Visio. Working experience with MS Project, MS Team Foundation Server, SharePoint and other industry standard tools is a plus. Basic knowledge of one or more of the following is a plus: Windows Servers Internet Information Server Networking Web Development Java Application Lifecycle Management System Development Lifecycle Security Scans Project Management What IT-Strat has to offer: IT-Strat has a robust benefits package for all full-time employees as we believe our employees are our greatest assets. Medical Benefits Dental Benefits Vision Benefits Paid Vacation Days Paid Holidays Paid Sick Days 401K Retirement Program Tuition Reimbursement Bereavement Leave …………And more!!!!! Name: MercuryGate Business Analyst
Description: Job Requirements:Participate in project work as the TMS SME to collect requirements and develop the design for the solutions within North American Supply Chain project portfolio, including SAP and MercuryGate TMS.Participate in project work to integrate data to and from North American Supply Chain systems including SAP, SAP IM, MercuryGate TMS, SPSS, AIMS WMS; document process and data flow, exception processing and troubleshooting documentation.Perform tasks to implement 3PL business and freight broker's customers onto the North American Supply Chain platform, including AIMS WMS, SAP and MercuryGate TMS applications performing configuration and related set-up tasks as needed.Create and deliver training to partners and end users as needed.Experience required: Minimum 5 years of experience within Supply Chain / Logistics in a technical role with a focus on transportation.  Desireable candidate would have minimum 2-3 years of experience with a TMS (ideally MercuryGate TMS) at least one of the systems (SAP, SAP IM, SAP WM, SPSS, AIMS WMS) with at least 5 implementations supporting hierarchy set up, configuration, user and role creation and maintenance and routing guide setup within MercuryGate TMS. Specific tasks:MercuryGate TMS: · Creating and navigating hierarchies and supporting configuration for divisions identified and their customers.  · Creating and scheduling automated reports within MercuryGate TMS according to best practices as needed to support requirements.  · Manage and support data integration between MercuryGate TMS and other Cardinal Health systems.  · Manage and support Web API and portal utilization of MercuryGate TMS.  · Creating customer rate tables to support pricing within MercuryGate TMS.  · Supporting customer invoicing based on customer rate tables.  · Supporting carrier rate tables to support rating within MercuryGate TMS.  · Supporting accessorial tables and alt rate tables.  · Supporting FP&A (Freight Pay and Audit) processes.  · Create and manage MercuryGate ACE project tasks and overall tasks requested from the software vendor including gathering requirements, reviewing estimates and providing test plan and test data to support approval of work. SAP: Functional knowledge of SAP transactions (sales order, purchase order, inbound delivery, stock transfer order, outbound delivery)  Working knowledge or ability to learn SAP to support data integration between systems (IDoc's, IDoc processing, table queries, output control) Experience desired:Inbound and outbound transportation management (domestic and international) experience with parcel, courier, LTL, TL, and air carriers, freight forwarders, freight brokers and freight pay-and audit of invoices.Developing and improving processes to ensure consistency, quality, and efficiency in an organization's Transportation Management System and functional operations.Familiar with MercuryEDGE and MOJO optimization tool.Experience with MercuryGate portals and training carriers, customers, warehouse operations.Experience with SAP ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) system "Logistics ", "Sales and Distribution ", "Finance " and "Procurement " modules.Experience with Warehouse Management Systems and Operations Nesco Resource is an equal employment opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, or veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristics with respect to employment opportunities.

Name: Business Analyst - SAP, Sales & Distribution
Description: Position Summary The Business Analyst-SAP, Sales & Distribution will be responsible for working with business process owners and Subject Matter Experts to understand business processes within the area of Sales, Logistics, Warehouse Management and Shipping, including Variant Configuration and EDI. He/she will be responsible for translating business process design to the technical design and system configuration of Simpson's SAP ERP system. He/she will responsible for documentation of processes and configuration, SAP system configuration, unit testing, integration testing, leading User Acceptance testing activities with Business Stakeholders, and ensuring that proper IT Change Control and Project Management processes are adhered to. He/she will be involved in the implementation of the SAP ERP system, as well as the on-going maintenance and enhancement to the SAP system in the area of Sales and Distribution and Warehouse Management. He/she will also be responsible for managing a queue of support requests, as well as potentially working with offshore teams to support the ERP system. This position requires excellent business process design experience; understanding of business objectives and value management, strong verbal and written communication skills, and the ability to manage relationships with business partners, IT, senior management and vendor organizations. This position is a member of the Global IT Applications team, reporting to the Manager of ERP & Finance Applications. Responsibilities 60% of the time: Manages projects of small size and scope with minimal direction including project planning, execution, timing, functionality, quality and cost. Delivers portfolio of approved IT projects/deliverable on time, on budget, with expected quality and value generation. Translate user's requests into application system solutions. Analyzes system user requirements to define and design system configuration, enhancements, and modifications. Resolves business issues by working with various groups within and outside of the company (ie. system users, company management, consultants, and software support staff) Work in multidisciplinary teams to define and design complex processes and procedures for the configuration, upgrade, and maintenance of SAP and related application systems. Designs test plans, executes test scenarios, validates test data, and documents test results. Coordinates end-user training documentation and trains end users as required.  15% of the time: Develops technical standards, best practice guidelines, solution diagrams, and documentation standards for all ERP and related solutions. Ensures that standards are adhered to, and that documentation and change control processes are followed across the Applications Organization.  15% of the time: Works with partners and vendor organizations and provides oversight on all technical deliverables. Ensures that we have consistency across all our processes and enhancement work. Ensures that work provided by partners meets Simpson's internal standards, and is ultimately accountable for the solutions delivered.  10% of the time: Participates and provides input to overall IT Systems and Applications Strategy for IT, and drives the overall realization of value for IT Initiatives. Will be jointly responsible for Data Governance initiatives and will help to make sure that Data Governance goals are met. QualificationsQualificationsB.S. degree in engineering, computer science or related technical field is requiredPMP Certification is preferredSAP Certification in one or more modules3+ years SAP Implementation experience with hands-on configuration experience in the SD and WM moduleSAP Sales and Distribution(SD) ModuleExpertise in SAP Order to Cash and Shipping ProcessesFamiliar with EDI processingExperience with WEB based on line order interfaceIncluding Variant Configuration - PreferredSAP Warehouse Management (WM) ModuleWarehouse and Inventory ManagementShipERP - PreferredCross functional knowledge of FI, SD, PP, WM moduleResponsibility for designing custom solutions within the ECC landscape as well as solutions involving integrations with external systems.3 years responsibility for translating business requirements into an SAP solution design.1-2 years Full Life Cycle large project implementation.Project ManagementEnterprise-level project implementation experience specifically with SAP ERP implementationsAbility to meet strict deadlines and work with multiple groups and stakeholders to deliver solutions.Demonstrated success working with business partners to evaluate, recommend, and implement highly-available, secure, mission-critical applications.Demonstrated experience managing projects within a defined SDLC process.Technical ExpertiseSAP Configuration and/or Development experience across multiple modules of SAP.
