Name: Business Analyst - FiveOut
Description: *Position Summary:** The primary purpose of this position is to serve as a supporting liaison between members of the technical team and the business user community to analyze business and user needs, elicit and document requirements, identify system enhancements, and determine impacts to current processes. This is a client facing, consulting role, and as such, will require up to 80% travel.*Primary Duties & Responsibilities:** + Elicits requirements, defines business requirements, use cases and user stories, and performs analysis on a solution implementation  + Implements techniques for eliciting and validating requirements including: Brainstorming, JAD Sessions, RAD Sessions, Interviews, Surveys, Nominal Group Technique, and/or Structured Walkthroughs  + Conducts functional specification review sessions with cross-functional team members  + Conducts structured walkthroughs of process flow diagrams to establish ?As-Is? and ?To-Be? states  + Ensures business requirements are met, optimal system design is achieved and differences between business requirements and systems capabilities are resolved  + Leverages business experience and analytical skills to define recommendations and process improvements through industry best practices and personal line of business knowledge.  + Identifies potential solutions and evaluates them for both technical and business suitability  + Serve as a liaison between business users and developers  + Contributes to the adoption services/efforts of an implementation project  + Develops training materials for end users *Basic Qualifications:** + Bachelor?s Degree in Systems Analysis, Information Technology, Business, or related field  + At least three (3) years? full software lifecycle development experience in a Business Analyst or similar role *Other Position Requirements:** + Demonstrated ability to work autonomously on BA-related tasks/activities to develop end-customer deliverables  + Experience with various project methodologies including Agile and Waterfall implementation approaches  + Experience with requirements management through a requirements tracking tool (e.g., Jira, SpiraTeam)  + Demonstrated ability to understand and explain both technical material & business-oriented consulting  + Demonstrated communication and presentation skills  + Demonstrated skills in establishing interpersonal relationships with all levels, including business and end-user stakeholders *Preferred Requirements:** + Experience with one or more of the following: Adobe Experience Manager, Adobe Analytics, Adobe Target, Adobe Audience Manager, Adobe Campaign, ecommerce, web, mobile & digital marketing platforms and projects  + Consulting experience  + Experience delivering projects on Cloud platforms *Data Privacy & Security:** + All Sirius employees are responsible to safeguard the information and information systems that they use or handle in the execution of their duties. Employees are obligated to know and perform their duties in accordance with Sirius policies, standards, and procedures related to security and report security violations to the appropriate Sirius authority.  + Participate at hire and annually in the Information Security Awareness training as well as other required training identified by the Human Resources department. Other data privacy and data security related regulatory training may be required based on your role or assignment. *_Essential Functions:_** _This position exists to provide consulting solutions to customers a_ _nd as such requires the ability to travel to and from customer sites and interact with customers on an ongoing and regular basis._ The above primary duties, responsibilities, and position requirements are not all inclusive.  Sirius is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity. As a government contractor, Sirius takes affirmative action to employ and advance in employment qualified women, minorities, individuals with disabilities, and protected veterans; maintains a drug-free workplace; and participates in E-Verify.  Individuals who receive job offers will be required to complete pre-employment screening that includes a background check verifying name, residences, education, work experience, and criminal convictions consistent with the Fair Credit Reporting Act; and a drug test for controlled substances consistent with the Drug-Free Workplace Act and the Americans with Disabilities Act.  Sirius will not sponsor work eligibility for this position.

Name: Omnichannel (Omni) Senior Business Analyst Lead
Description: We are transforming the way we do business by changing how we think about the different types of Customer Journeys. Omnichannel will provide a consistent experience for our customers, regardless of how they chose to do business with us (online banking, branch locations, ATM's, phone support). The goal of Omnichannel is to align our people, processes, products & services, and technology across our enterprise to deliver new modern capabilities in an Agile and Iterative way.  We are in the beginning stages of building this newly defined Omnichannel program with cross functional team members. This team will lay the foundation for what the Customer Journeys are and how we will deliver exceptional, streamlined experiences for each one. If you are a pioneer at heart who enjoys data driven decisions that takes our customers' feedback and intertwines creativity to define what the solutions should be, we want to hear more.  The Omnichannel (Omni) Senior Business Analyst will work cross functionally with business partners and IT, typically serving as the primary BA on projects. The Senior Business Analyst will perform detailed business analysis, documenting functional and design requirements including process flows, use cases and functional design. Additionally, this role will work with Project Managers coordinating various project timelines and deliverables throughout the project lifecycle. This position requires close collaboration with multiple business stakeholders to build out Customer Journeys within the Omni program.  Basic Qualifications: Bachelor's DegreeMinimum of 7 years of experience in business analysis related work Preferred Qualifications: Project planning and management, with the ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment and meet deadlinesExperience in a Business Analyst role performing the listed responsibilities, including experience with the following artifacts is desirable:Assisting in creation of scope documentsEliciting and documenting functional requirements and use casesProducing process flows using VisioDocumenting Functional design/Functional SpecificationsDemonstrable technical skills and ability to learn technologyStrong organization, written and oral communication skillsExperience facilitating group sessions to gather requirements with ability to ask relevant questions to drill into the detailsExperience tracking and driving deliverables to completion EEO/AA Employer/Minority/Female/Disability/Veteran/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity  Tobacco-Free Hiring Practice: Visit Huntington's Career Web Site for more details.  Huntington does not accept solicitation from Third Party Recruiters for any position.

Name: Business Analyst-SAP, MM/WM
Description: Position Summary The Business Analyst-SAP, MM/WM will be responsible for the design, implementation, and maintenance of Simpson Strong Tie's corporate SAP ERP System, with an expertise focus on MM and WM. The IT Business Analyst will be responsible for working with business process owners and SME's to understand business processes within the area of Materials Management, Logistics, Warehouse Management, and Shipping. The MM/WM Analyst focus will be on ensuring that solutions designed in our SAP ERP environment are completed with a sustainable, high quality, and best practice design in mind. The ideal candidate will have experience in the MM and WM SAP modules as a functional/technical expert and hands-on configurator, but will have also had a broad understanding of SAP across multiple SAP modules. He/she should have implementation experience with a global manufacturing company, and understand both systems configuration, and overall systems architecture in an SAP environment. He/she should be familiar with SAP's ecosystem of solutions and solutions providers, and be able to guide business decisions on functionality, software selection, and vendor selection. The IT Business Analyst MM/WM will also be responsible for technical delivery and have project management responsibilities as part of his/her job role. This position requires excellent verbal and written communication skills to interface and manage relationships with business partners, IT, senior management and vendor organizations. This position is a member of the Project Management Team reporting to the ERP & Finance Applications Manager. Whether it’s IT Consulting, Infrastructure Services, Security, Enterprise Service Management or Interactive, we’re all about finding solutions that advance your career aspirations. Our ongoing client relationships speak to our long-term collaborative partnerships. Position Description: Manage all activities related to conducting preliminary cost/benefit analysis, needs assessments, and business requirements analysis in an effort to align business needs with solutions on the business initiatives. Will conduct detailed enterprise analysis in order to support requests that require pricing/quote for vendors or internal build that will be transitioned to internal partners and execution/solution teams. May also lead process analysis and mapping for non-technical improvement projects. Ensures projects meet the needs of the users and that quality and resource commitments are met. Additionally, serves as liaison between the business community and execution or technical team members to ensure that its needs are fully understood by the project team Fosters and coordinates communication across multiple work streams and projects • Will serve as a mentor to other BA’s providing insights to professional development with peers that are in alignment with Alliance Data culture and best practices • Drive Process Improvement projects or re-engineering by documenting and analyzing business processes and works with business teams to identify gaps and remediation plansEducation: • Undergraduate Degree preferred but equivalent experience will be consideredWork Experience: • Three or more years’ experience as a BA/BSA/PM or equivalent • Experience working in experience translating customer needs into business requirements preferred • Experience with PC based tools and products including but not limited to MSOffice and MS Visio • Strong Analytical, problem-solving and basic project management skills in a regulated environment • Knowledge of the New Business process and Business Development Life-cycle preferred • Supervisory experience preferred.Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities • Ability to understand, create and manage the basic tools (i.e. process maps / flows, rules matrices, mockups etc.) and advanced tools and techniques of business analysis (i.e. data matrices, contextual level data diagrams, system interface diagrams etc.) • The ability to evaluate details and develop a full understanding of business requirements, impacts and potential issues across various processes, departments, products and lines of business Document detailed business requirements and supporting documentation into standardized tools and templates (Includes: Stakeholder analysis, Business rules analysis, Data analysis, Decision analysis, and Costs benefit analysis) • Manages the expectations of business owners, subject matter experts Name: O365 Migration Sr. Business Analyst
Description: LOCAL TO OHIO CANDIDATES ONLY PLEASE Client requests a Business Analyst for the upgrade of our current Office 2013 environment to Office 365. PURPOSE: The employee shall provide expertise regarding FCCS business operations, collaborate with cross-functional teams to explore business process improvement opportunities, and shall model both present and future state business operations using various industry-standard modelling and analysis techniques in order to help move from the present to the future state. 1) The employee shall participate in agency projects by analyzing business processes, eliciting and documenting project requirements, ensuring requirements traceability throughout all project work products and project phases, contributing to test and implementation plans, and participating in system testing, user acceptance testing, and implementation. To achieve these ends, the employee shall facilitate meetings with customers and service delivery staff. 2) The employee shall also provide ongoing customer support for custom and packaged software solutions. 3) The employee shall also help improve the agency’s business analysis procedures, standards, and project performance reporting. 4) The employee shall also help research new technologies, methodologies, and operating models to more quickly and efficiently achieve these objectives. The employee will help the agency achieve Child and Family Services Review (CFSR) standards and help ensure service delivery that focuses on Safety, Permanency and Well-being for the families served by the agency. The employee is committed to practicing cultural competence by: working respectfully and effectively with people of all cultures, classes, races, genders, ethnic backgrounds, religions, sexual orientations, mental and physical abilities, ages and appearances in a manner that recognizes, affirms and values the worth of individuals, families and communities and protects and preserves the dignity of each. The employee will adhere to the agency’s Guiding Principles by serving as a child welfare professional, valuing every child, honoring families, and valuing partnerships. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS/EDUCATION /TRAINING REQUIRED: 5 years experience as a Management Analyst 1 / Business Analyst or completion of undergraduate major program core course work in business administration, management science, or public administration, and 6 months experience in research & analysis and written documentation of findings; or 3 years of experience in research & analysis and written documentation of findings. PREFERRED: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field. 5+ years of experience as a business analyst in support of business and technology projects with a strong preference for experience supporting child welfare services. Experience upgrading prior versions of Office to Office 365. Preferred character traits include: very strong customer focus, listening skills, oral and written communication skills; excellent judgment in ambiguous situations; proven ability to facilitate collaboration within cross-functional teams; well organized, and self-motivated. Preferred experience includes: creating business case documents, documenting requirements, developing business models (ex. entity/class diagrams, activity/process diagrams, state diagrams, conceptual models, RACI matrices, role/responsibility matrices, etc.), analyzing gaps between present and future states, reengineering business processes, making presentations to business teams and executive management, and generating work estimates. Preferred knowledge includes: SharePoint, PowerPoint, cloud-based solutions, packaged software implementation, computing infrastructure, agile and iterative system engineering processes, government operations, and Business Analyst Book of Knowledge (BABOK). International Institute of Business Analyst (IIBA) Certification. Need a valid driver's license and ability to drive when needed. - provided by DiceOffice 365 | MS Office | Agile | Cloud | Active Directory | Exchange | Business Analysis |

Name: Analyst
Description: Who we areKlarnas mission is to free people from all the meaningless time spent managing money and purchases, so they can do more of what they love. Every day at Klarna we help consumers, merchants, and partners to explore just how smoooth the modern purchase experience can be. Our position at the crossroads of payments, consumer financing, ecommerce and banking means we are uniquely positioned to do this. There is no label for what we do. Klarna was born in Stockholm in 2005 and today has 2000 employees working across Europe and the US. We currently serve 60 million consumers, work together with 90,000 merchants and process more than a million payment transactions a day. We are growing at 40% year on year and our investors include Visa, Atomico, Sequoia Capital, Permira and Bestseller group/ Anders Holsch Povlsen. We have strong partnerships with some of the worlds leading brands, such as ASOS, IKEA, Adidas, Zara, Lufthansa and Spotify. To find out more about what it's like to work at Klarna: https://www.klarna.com/careers/What.Analytics at Klarna is divided into many teams, all with their own unique responsibilities. However, there are some commonalities - they consist of highly driven people with a combination of analytical skills and a great team spirit. In general, some things you would potentially be doing:Designing and implementing strategies in a rapidly evolving industry.Pro-actively and effectively communicating with various stakeholders, discussing the root cause of trends, assessing their impact and proposing solutions/optimizations.Supporting wider business objectives by providing analytical expertise on new products and system developments and collaborating closely with other teams where relevant.Delivering ad-hoc data analysis to support risk mitigation and control environment.Developing as a professional in an entrepreneurial organization that provides opportunity to work with your areas of interest.Using analytical tools (e.g. SQL, Excel, R) to analyze data and problem solve with the end goal of detecting trends and making decisions.You.Klarna is looking for ambitious people with significant drive. You should be passionate about your job and enjoy a fast paced international working environment. Since you will play an important role in taking Klarna to the next level, you should desire to go above and beyond to produce the best work results. At Klarna we embrace change; you should dare to challenge the status quo and be persistent.Required.A degree from a university in a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics) or a Business field.Applicable work experience.Working proficiency and communication skills in verbal and written English.Authorization to work in the United States.Significant drive and ambition.Strong conceptual ability.Preferred.Strong attention to detail and experience in using structured approaches to problem solving.An understanding for how to perform data extraction and manipulation, as well as programming languages is a plus (SQL, R, Python, MatLab, Java, C# etc.).We can offer you an international working environment filled with smart and ambitious colleagues. We know that diverse teams are strong teams, so we welcome those from different backgrounds and experiences. As part of one of Europes fastest growing companies, you'll help play an important role in taking Klarna to the next level.

Name: Business Analyst- JDEdwards Finance
Description: Company: Worthington Industries, IncWe are dedicated to the belief that people are our most important asset. In filling job openings every effort is expended to find candidates within Worthington, its divisions or subsidiaries. Employee development, opportunity to grow and continuing to evolve both as an employee and as a company are instrumental to our success. We encourage employees to inquire about open positions and apply to those that help further their career goals.Summary Worthington Industries is looking for an entry level JDEdwards Business Analyst. This person is responsible for supporting and improving how the organization utilizes JDE EnterpriseOne software. This includes production system issue resolution, trouble-shooting, and training. Also includes the analysis of business requirements, developing alternatives for improvement, creating formal system requests (as required), testing, documenting, and implementation planning. Plays a role in the implementation of JDE for new acquisitions, and additional applications/systems.  This person should have a basic knowledge of JDE applications, and will be trained on Worthington Industries’ specific requirements and initiatives. This position comes with the opportunity to travel domestically and internationally. ResponsibilitiesHas a basic knowledge of JDE functional applications supported: (Manufacturing, Distribution, with an emphasis on Finance & Accounting) Current functionality, planned functionality, pain-points, workarounds, impacts, timetables, etc.Manages the research, resolution, escalation and prioritization of business issues.Meets with business partners, stakeholders, and solution leads to understand current system needs, future goals, and help to establish realistic timetables for completion.Facilitates and executes efforts related to system configuration changes (set-up, testing, compliance, and analysis of results).Develops necessary documentation associated with recommended business system changes.Meets with internal IT staff to communicate/educate the business’ desired system changes.Willingness to travel.Other duties as assigned.Desired ExperienceAbility to work effectively with cross functional departmentsDetail and process orientedFlexible and adaptable to changeSelf-motivated and possesses the ability to complete tasks on time and with little supervisionVery good problem solving skillsMust have above average written, verbal communication skillsExcellent organizational skillsEducation Bachelors in Business or Information Systems  Bachelors or equivalent in Accounting or FinanceWorthington Industries Inc., and its subsidiaries, is an equal employment opportunity employer. Qualified applicants are considered regardless of race, color, religion, age, national origin, sex, disability or veteran’s status. Nearest Major Market: Columbus Nearest Secondary Market: Dublin Job Segment: Business Analyst, Financial, Information Systems, Financial Analyst, Finance, Technology

Name: Reporting Analyst
Description: Overview  Under the general supervision of the Director of Support Services this position assumes responsibility for the design and implementation of ad-hoc and static reporting solutions for leadership and third party clients.  The Reporting Analyst's role is to plan, design, develop, and implement reporting solutions in support of core organizational functions, as well as client initiatives. This individual will apply proven communication, analytical and problem-solving skills to help identify and develop reports to provide valuable information demonstrating program outcomes. ResponsibilitiesESSENTIAL FUNCTIONSMeet with critical staff members to define operating measures important to business operations.Analyzes data, prepares complex analytical and statistical reports, and makes recommendations for a variety of programmatic, administrative, and operational projects.Design, develop and implement reporting solutions to provide feedback on critical organizational outcomes.Serve as a consultant to management, coordinating and developing comprehensive reports to improve the overall development and execution of organizational programs. This includes quantitative or qualitative analysis and evaluation of programs, and providing management with information about improving initiatives and strategic plans.Analyze user and client needs and assist in the planning, design, development and deployment of new reporting applications and enhancements to existing reporting applications; maintain existing leadership and customer reports and develop new reports to address additional requirements as neededReview and analyze the effectiveness and efficiency of existing reporting systems and develop strategies for improving or further leveraging these systems.Design and implement solutions to meet leadership and client needs and requirements. Ensure compatibility and interoperability of various information system applications for the organization.Create specifications, forms and other documents as necessary to ensure adequate technical and end user documentation exists for reporting systems and applications.Coordinate the development and implementation of reporting solutions with other IT initiatives. Provide assistance to other staff members for other projects that include a reporting component.Understand day-to-day operations within the Quality Assurance Department and Service Coordination.Performs other duties as assigned.NON-ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONSAssist with the marketing of services and onboarding of clients new to Support Services (QA, Care Guide)Present analysis and general information to funders, potential clients, and other internal and external stakeholdersCollaborate with other departments as needed to accomplish organization level technical or analytical goalsEXPECTATIONSDemonstrates and maintains a positive, professional manner, manages time efficiently and effectively, provides leadership as a role model to promote a team approach, collaborates and participates in policy creation and appropriate problem solving methods.With respect to Resident/Client Rights, ensures all care is provided with respect and dignity for clients, reports all complaints made by clients and/or families to the appropriate supervisors, reports all allegations of abuse, misappropriation of funds/client property and/or any other corporate compliance items immediately.Must adhere to all policies, procedures, terms and conditions set forth in the National Church Residences' Employee Information Guide (EIG) as well as any facility/agency handbook including but not limited to corporate compliance, drug free workplace, and safe work practices, all federal, state, local regulations and laws.Must be a self-starter with exceptional organizational and time management skills, and the ability to exercise independent judgement.Strong computer aptitude and ability to utilize effectively all Microsoft Office programs, i.e. Excel, Access, Word, Power Point and Outlook. Advanced knowledge of Excel needed.Collaborates in a team environment supporting others through knowledge and idea sharing.Excellent written and oral communication and customer service skillsQualifications Education: Bachelor's degree in a computer-related discipline, mathematics or engineering or equivalent experience preferred.  Experience: A minimum of 2-3 years of IT experience as a business analyst or programmer. 1-2 years relevant experience utilizing Crystal Reports, Power BI or other reporting engines.  Skills: Requires strong analytical, problem-solving and computer skills. Experience with Crystal Reports, Business Objects or WEBii required. Experience utilizing data from Microsoft SQL Server, writing queries and stored procedures; experience using Power BI and SQL Server Reporting Services a plus. Experience supporting 3rd party applications including troubleshooting, problem identification, suggesting, and implementing resolutions is a plus. Previous experience building a complete reporting solution to satisfy the needs of multiple customer groups required.  Must have demonstrated proficiency in at least one of the programming and job control languages in used in the department: - *HTML, JAVA, Javascript, JavaServer (JSP), JDBC, RDBMS/SQL) - Required  2EE/JEE, XML, Integrated Development Environment - Required  Mental: Must have the ability to speak, read, write and understand English. Requires good communication, comprehension, and interpersonal skills.  Vision: The degree of hand and eye coordination as applied to job requirements that induce visual strain. Normal: Consistent with standard workflow.SDL2017

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: Title : Business Systems Analyst  Location : Columbus, OH  Duration : 3+ Years  Points will be awarded based on the education, experience, and availability of the proposed candidates for the Data Curator position. Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: The Business Analyst acts on behalf of the business unit to identify and drive improvement in processes and systems. Performs a variety of complex tasks, such as designing and documenting business process and systems logic.Provides technical training, guidance, and resource support for end users and departmental staff.Defines system requirements, priorities, and viable alternatives.Coordinates the efforts of business and IT teams to locate, assess, install, test, and maintain computer software systems.Drives systems analysis and design as part of the software development life cycle (SDLC).Coordinates conversions and upgrades to vendor systems.Performs as a project lead and directs other systems analysts or application developers.Assists in developing user documentation and departmental policies and procedures.Proactively performs process and systems analysis and makes recommendations for improvement that positively impact overall cost, efficiency, or quality.Bachelor's degree required. Master’s degree preferred.5+ years experience in systems analysis and/or software development life cycle, including project management or leadership responsibilities required.Ability to exercise independent judgment in planning, organizing, and performing systems analyst tasks.Must have ability to communicate and organize projects frequently under deadline pressure.

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Title : Senior Business Analyst  Location : Columbus, OH  Duration : 5+ Months Required Skills:7 years experience in the analysis, documentation of business requirements functional and non-functional7 years experience creating application prototypes and screen mockups7 years experience creating graphical representations of complex business processes7 years experience in using Microsoft products; Visio, PowerPoint, Excel and Word7 years experience facilitating workshops for requirements gathering5 years experience managing requirements on several projects at the same time7 years experience in analyzing data elements of enterprise applications; determining how the data elements relate to each other6 years experience with business process modeling methods and techniques7 years experience performing Gap analysis As-Is/To-Be for large applicationsRoles & Responsibilities:Work with business units and other stakeholders to gather requirements, using techniques such as interviews and requirement gathering sessions.Elicit, analyze, document, and communicate business requirements as well translate them into more detailed user stories and/or use cases, and other functional requirements documents such as process flows, screen mock-ups, gap analysis (also known as Business Requirements Documents)Create documents and other artifacts to promote sustainable knowledge management within the organization.Work closely with the program manager, project manager and senior business analyst.Experience conducting Facilitated Workshops for requirements analysis.Experience creating workflows using formal notation such as the Business Process Modeling Notation (BPMN).Knowledge of formal requirements gathering methodologies.Experience developing Business Requirements - project initiation document, what the needed achievements will be, and the quality measures.Experience developing Functional requirements - describe what the system, process, or product/service must do to fulfill the business requirements.Experience developing User (stakeholder) requirements - are a very important part of the deliverables, the needs of the stakeholders will have to be correctly interpreted. This deliverable can also reflect how the product will be designed, developed, and define how test cases must be formulated.Experience developing Report Specifications - define the purpose of a report, its justification, attributes and columns, owners and runtime parameters.Experience developing Requirements Traceability Matrix - a cross matrix for recording the requirements through each stage of the requirements gathering process.Strong organizational skills.Strong English writing skills.Experience developing graphic representations of complex business processes.Experience in a leadership role as a Business Analyst.Ability to be a self-starter in a fast-paced environment.Ability to communicate with many different stakeholders.

The Paragon Group provides staff augmentation, temp-to-perm placements, permanent placements, and consulting services both locally and nationally. Name: Business Analysts
Description: Business Analysts Our Business Analysts analyze operations to understand strengths and weaknesses to determine opportunities to automate processes and functions. Name: Senior IT Business Analyst
Description: Kinray was established in 1944 as a small NY-based pharmaceutical distributorship, dedicated to servicing the independent pharmacy. Cardinal Health and Kinray combined in 2010 . Cardinal Health, a Fortune 13 company headquartered in Columbus, OH is a health care services company that improves the cost-effectiveness of healthcare. Kinray is now strengthened and supported by Cardinal Health to provide our independent pharmacies with even more value-added services to help our pharmacies achieve success.  We currently have a full-time career opening for a Senior IT Business Analyst . This role can reside at our Kinray office in Queens, NY or at our Cardinal Health offices in Dublin, OH. Role Overview Amazing opportunity to be the conduit between the business and IT. This individual should be curious and willing to delve into learning all aspects of the business. Great opportunity to learn the retail independent space as well as being part of a profitable fast-paced environment.  Additional Responsibilities Include: Work directly with functional business partners across the entire Kinray business unit including Consumer Health, Contracts & Chargebacks, Customer Service, Finance, Sales, Strategic Pricing, and Warehouse Management (WM).Opportunity to learn about Kinray’s E-Commerce site, “Weblink”, and play a role in Kinray’s E-Commerce transformation.The role will be key to the Warehouse Management, Operations Management and E-commerce transformation of Kinray.Direct exposure to Warehouse Operations, as the IT team is co-located with both the Kinray Business and the Kinray Distribution Center.What Business Analysis contributes to Cardinal HealthBusiness Analysis is responsible for deeply understanding the business in multiple functional areas and across Business Units, as well as understanding the application landscape and capabilities. They maintain relationships with the business and leverage requirements engineering practices and methods to enable improved business processes to drive business success. They align business strategies and capability needs into business and technical requirements to ensure IT systems enable the desired value.Knows and executes best practices for business analysis processes and functions (from an industry and strategic standpoint), including requirements elicitation methods. Knows emerging trends.Defines requirements in accordance with SDP/SDLC, management and project/product scope. Ensures problem statements and objectives are clearly defined. Ensures requirements are aligned to project scope, objectives and strategies.Leads elicitation sessions using variety of requirements gathering methods such as interviews, documentation analysis, surveys, site visits, business models with executives, managers, developers and subject matter experts.Facilitates the team through the analysis of, and makes recommendations towards, complex business decisions.Mediates across different IT teams utilizing knowledge of IT and roles and responsibilities within the organization.Focuses on process analysis and re-engineering, with an understanding of technical problems and solutions as they relate to the current and future business environment.Demonstrates excellent listening, communication, and facilitation skills.What is expected of you and others at this levelApplies advanced knowledge and understanding of concepts, principles, and technical capabilities to manage a wide variety of projectsParticipates in the development of policies and procedures to achieve specific goalsRecommends new practices, processes, metrics, or modelsWorks on or may lead complex projects of large scopeProjects may have significant and long-term impactProvides solutions which may set precedentIndependently determines method for completion of new projectsReceives guidance on overall project objectivesActs as a mentor to less experienced colleaguesQualificationsProven experience as an IT Business Analyst on IT specific projects.Experience working with E-commerce and/or supply chain is preferred.Bachelors Degree in related field or equivalent work experience5+ years experience in related field preferredProficiency in Microsoft Office products preferred Cardinal Health is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.Apply

Name: Senior Business Systems Analyst
Description: When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co., you’re not just working at a global financial institution. You’re an integral part of one of the world’s biggest tech companies. In 14 technology hubs worldwide, our team of 40,000 technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $9.5B annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that will not only transform the financial services industry, but also change the world. At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of every employee, and we’re building a technology organization that thrives on diversity. We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation. If you’re looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you. Our Corporate & Investment Bank relies on innovators like you to build and maintain the technology that helps us safely service the world’s important corporations, governments and institutions. You’ll develop solutions for a bank entrusted with holding $18 trillion of assets and $393 billion in deposits. CIB provides strategic advice, raises capital, manages risk, and extends liquidity in markets spanning over 100 countries around the world.As a Senior Business Systems Analyst for the TS Admin Center team, you will serve as a liaison between technical resources and the lines of business in order to define and ensure the successful delivery of system solutions for J.P. Morgan Chase's wholesale customer base (specifically for the Treasury and Security Services, Commercial and Business Banking lines of business). This position requires a strong background in system design and software development as well as a high level of expertise in business process reengineering and business modeling concepts. Additional Responsibilities Include:Analyzing the business, operational, functional and non-functional requirements and for producing Functional Specification Documents related to those requirements. Supporting the Agile Project Management Methodology, and is responsible for creating stories based on functional requirements, creating and socializing acceptance criteria for the stories and for performing functional testing.Communicate effectively is critical as you will work closely with both with groups, business and technical teams to ensure that line of business goals and requirements are successfully met with technology solutions. Demonstrate partnership and collaboration. Interface with both technology and business partners at all levels and across multiple organization. BS/BA Degree or equivalent experience.7 years of Business Systems Analyst and/or Business Analyst experience.Excellent communication skills to deal with diverse teams and demanding clients. Experience working with business partners to develop and define technology project scopes, requirements, and operational impacts (migrations support, etc).Experience producing Functional Specification Documents supporting business requirements.Experience working with technology team to review project requirements, design and test plans/results to confirm that line of business goals are met.Experience supporting all aspects of the development life cycle through implementation.

Name: Business Systems Analyst - Neurovascular Stroke Center
Company: The Ohio State University Wexner Medical Center
Description: Job Title: Business Systems Analyst Job ID: 442333 Location: University Hospitals Department: Neurovascular Stroke Center Full/Part Time: Full-Time Regular/Temporary: Regular Shift: Day FTE %: 100 Salary Range Min: $54,800.00 Salary Range Max: $82,200.00 Position summaryBusiness Systems Analyst (Job Opening 442333) - The position supports the Neurovascular Stroke Center leadership including Medical & Surgical Directors and Director of the Stroke Center and program manager for Telestroke. The Data Analyst will have expertise to abstract, merge, manage and prepare data in the form of useful information to aid analysis by the Comprehensive Stroke Center leadership, who with this information, can enhance the quality of clinical care. This data will also be utilized to maintain Comprehensive Stroke Center Certification and to assist with the sustainability of the Telestroke Program. The Data Analyst will work collaboratively with the department of Quality and Patient Safety as they provide abstraction and reporting to Get-With-The-Guidelines and TJC and will assist in development of materials to support all TJC site visits Education and experienceBachelors degree required and 0-4 years experience in health information management; analyzing and interpreting data and a lead role in process improvement. Master's degree in Business Administration or Public Health preferred. Experience with utilization of Microsoft office, preferably experience with SAS, SPSS and Tableau .

Name: Business Analyst (Office 365 Implementation) in Columbus, OH
Description: Job Title : Business Analyst/BA3 Location : Columbus, OH Duration : 6+ Months Interviews: Onsite interview required MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS/EDUCATION /TRAINING REQUIRED: Experience upgrading prior versions of Office to Office 365 as a Business Analyst. PREFERRED: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field. 5+ years of experience as a business analyst in support of business and technology projects with a strong preference for experience supporting child welfare services. Preferred character traits include: very strong customer focus, listening skills, oral and written communication skills; excellent judgment in ambiguous situations; proven ability to facilitate collaboration within cross-functional teams; well organized, and self-motivated. Preferred experience includes: creating business case documents, documenting requirements, developing business models (ex. entity/class diagrams, activity/process diagrams, state diagrams, conceptual models, RACI matrices, role/responsibility matrices, etc.), analyzing gaps between present and future states, reengineering business processes, making presentations to business teams and executive management, and generating work estimates. Preferred knowledge includes: SharePoint, PowerPoint, cloud-based solutions, packaged software implementation, computing infrastructure, agile and iterative system engineering processes, government operations, and Business Analyst Book of Knowledge (BABOK). International Institute of Business Analyst (IIBA) Certification. Need a valid driver's license and ability to drive when needed. PURPOSE: The employee shall provide expertise regarding FCCS business operations, collaborate with cross-functional teams to explore business process improvement opportunities, and shall model both present and future state business operations using various industry-standard modelling and analysis techniques in order to help move from the present to the future state. 1) The employee shall participate in agency projects by analyzing business processes, eliciting and documenting project requirements, ensuring requirements traceability throughout all project work products and project phases, contributing to test and implementation plans, and participating in system testing, user acceptance testing, and implementation. To achieve these ends, the employee shall facilitate meetings with customers and service delivery staff. 2) The employee shall also provide ongoing customer support for custom and packaged software solutions. 3) The employee shall also help improve the agency’s business analysis procedures, standards, and project performance reporting. 4) The employee shall also help research new technologies, methodologies, and operating models to more quickly and efficiently achieve these objectives. The employee will help the agency achieve Child and Family Services Review (CFSR) standards and help ensure service delivery that focuses on Safety, Permanency and Well-being for the families served by the agency. The employee is committed to practicing cultural competence by: working respectfully and effectively with people of all cultures, classes, races, genders, ethnic backgrounds, religions, sexual orientations, mental and physical abilities, ages and appearances in a manner that recognizes, affirms and values the worth of individuals, families and communities and protects and preserves the dignity of each. The employee will adhere to the agency’s Guiding Principles by serving as a child welfare professional, valuing every child, honoring families, and valuing partnerships. JOB DUTIES: 85% The employee shall participate in the Office 365 Implementation project by analyzing business processes, eliciting and documenting project requirements, ensuring requirements traceability throughout all project work products and project phases, contributing to test and implementation plans, and participating in system testing, user acceptance testing, and implementation. 5% Help improve the agency’s business analysis procedures, standards, and project performance reporting. 5% Research new technologies, methodologies, and operating models to more quickly and efficiently achieve these objectives. 5% Perform other duties as assigned. *Position is subject to call-in during non-working hours as necessary* Thanks & Regards Venkat P Talent Acquisition Team 614-212-6580 Office x1002 355 East Campus View Blvd, Suite 195 Columbus, OH 43235 MBE & SBA 8(a) Certified 614-212-6582 Direct 614-423-2526 Fax pvr@comtech-global.com - provided by DiceBusiness Analyst/BA3 with Office 365 implementation from Office 2013

Name: Sr. Business Systems Analyst
Description: Title Sr. Business Systems Analyst  11-Oct-2018 Business US - Global IT State / Country / Province Ohio Job DescriptionAbout the Team Joining the Stanley Black & Decker team means joining one of the world’s largest, fastest-growing, and most dynamic companies. Stanley Black & Decker is unique in that we’ve got a rich and storied history dating back to 1843, but that hasn’t stopped us from evolving into a vibrant, diverse, global growth company poised and ready for the future.  Being a part of our team means living our core values of courage & innovationagility & performanceinclusivity & collaborationintegrity & accountability It means thriving in an environment of constant innovation and positive change. It means delivering tools, services, and solutions that the world counts on when it really matters. It means maintaining the highest standards in everything you do, every day. Position Summary Provides cost effective business systems and applications analysis in support of the development and implementation of business applications. Includes evaluation, analysis, documentation of requirements, translation into proper system requirement specifications and configuration. Formulates and defines systems scope and objectives based on both end-user needs and a thorough understanding of business systems, applications and industry requirements. Operates as a liaison between technical personnel and the appropriate end-user department. Evaluates and translates end user needs and problems to technical associates and/or vendors where appropriate. Understands the business implications of technical solutions, and assists in defining and documenting the technology solutions to support any future business needs. Teaches end users new technology and enhancements using all appropriate communication tools as well as providing support for existing system. You?ll support the delivery of award winning tools and services that cover everything from personal and small business banking as well as lending, mortgages, credit cards, payments, auto finance and investment advice. Name: Dynamics 365 CRM Business Analyst-Midwest
Description: Microsoft has heightened the importance and expectation for CRM solutions. As Microsoft's leading Dynamics CRM solution provider, Avanade combines extensive implementation expertise, leading practices, and user experience design with the strength, stability and power of Microsoft Dynamics CRM software enabling companies to maximize the business value of their CRM Solution. Across the globe and in multiple industries, Avanade helps enterprises create superior customer experiences, deepen customer relationships and maximize business agility.  About the role  CRM Business Analysis identifies and understands our clients customer relationship management needs. This involves staying current on CRM technologies (particularly Microsoft Dynamics CRM) and working with Avanade solution developers to recommend appropriate CRM technologies and functions that meet specific client needs.  As a Leader of CRM Business Analysis, you will lead teams in developing and deploying CRM solutions. You will ensure that client business requirements are met, while providing advisory services around project management, business process development, implementation support and end-user training. You will be familiar with the latest versions of Microsoft Dynamics CRM and related Independent Software Vendor (ISV) products.  Day-to-day, you will:  Work with Avanade delivery teams and client stakeholders to translate business  requirements into CRM solutions  Work with client leadership, end users and IT staff to identify, design and configure CRM solutions  Work with stakeholders to gather system requirements and own requirements management  Lead transfer of functional requirements to development and test teams  Determine needed patches and upgrades in collaboration with business and IT stakeholders  Educate end users on CRM functionality.QualificationsAbout you  You are a CRM wizard and motivational leader. Someone who is adept at understanding client business needs, translating them into technology specifics and leading teams to build finished solutions. You are likely a big-picture thinker and detail-oriented doer.  Your technical skills include:  Extensive knowledge of CRM systems and business solution implementations  Demonstrable experience in business process reengineering  Knowledge of CRM issue diagnosis and troubleshooting.  Your business skills include:  Experience consulting on complex projects and taking leadership role  Experience working with global teamsespecially offshore teamsto implement and maintain CRM systems  Demonstrated excellence in communicating and presenting complex information to technical and non-technical stakeholders, both orally and in writing.  You likely have at least five years of experience in business systems analysis, design or management and at least three years managing teams comprised of business and technical staff. Your education likely includes a Bachelors degree in a relevant field, preferably computer science, business administration, finance or information technology.  About Avanade  Avanade leads in providing innovative digital services, business solutions and design-led experiences for its clients, delivered through the power of people and the Microsoft ecosystem. Our professionals combine technology, business and industry expertise to build and deploy solutions to realize results for clients and their customers. Avanade has 27,000 digitally connected people across 23 countries, bringing clients the best thinking through a collaborative culture that honors diversity and reflects the communities in which we operate. Majority owned by Accenture, Avanade was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation. Learn more at www.avanade.com.  Avanade® Is An Equal Opportunity Employer. Name: Business Systems Analyst -

Name: Credit Bureau Operations Analyst
Description: As part of the Credit Bureau Furnishing team, you will be responsible for data mining and data analysis to derive performance improvement opportunities, isolate root causes, and collaborate on viable solutions to provide recommendations to senior management. This role will require frequent interaction and communication with cross-functional partners and presentation to managers and executives. The successful candidate will excel at creative thinking and problem solving, be self-motivated, confident and ready to work in a fast-paced energetic environment. *Key Activities** + Analyze data to determine monthly volumes and shifts month over month and provide clear/concise oral and written conclusions regarding underlying trends and opportunities  + Research, root cause and derive drivers of shifts in key risk indicators  + operational and quality control processes including review and advisory consultation on scope, sampling, testing, reporting and effectiveness of controls and corrective actions.  + Ability to streamline data inputs in order to turn around timely analysis that drives business oversight  + Responsible for credit bureau rejects and transformations of furnished data including monitoring and reporting on resolution.  + Interface in various forums to report on project and program milestones and present project needs and technical knowledge.  + Communicate regularly with stakeholders and provide consistent follow up on the status of issues  + Effective at complex problem resolution and expected to assist in resolving all difficult issues.  + Ability to analyze, interpret and translate metric performance across functions and across different lines of business  + Identify business opportunities by performing well thought analysis through data mining; ensuring data integrity, synthesizing and communicating findings to senior management  + Bachelor?s or Advanced analytic/quantitative discipline preferred  + 2+ years of experience business/data analysis  + Proven track record in solving business problems, AND/OR, Project Management Skills -- well-organized, structured approach.  + Technical skills a plus and may include SQL, SAS, Teradata, Oracle, UNIX and MS Office related products including Excel (Pivot tables, charts / graphs and formulas)  + Self-starter with ability to drive for resolution  + Strong communication and interpersonal skills with ability to interact with individuals across departments / functions and with senior-level executives  + Ability to work independently and in a team environment, excellent relationship management skills  + Demonstrated strong problem solving skills, especially in a fast-paced environment  + Excellent communication, and project management skills  + Strong familiarity with data manipulation  + Possess strong interpersonal skills for partnering with various levels of the organization and influencing results  JPMorgan Chase is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer Disability/Veteran.

GPI provides its clients with expertise and personnel to assist them in accomplishing their objectives. GPI is currently interviewing for positions within the staff augmentation program with state agencies in Columbus. We are actively screening candidates to meet the time constraints of the program, a four day turn around to submit candidates, and provide the most qualified candidates. The business analyst positions range from Junior to Senior and typically require the following skills. Name: Business Analyst Identity Governance & Administration
Description: As an experienced professional in our Cybersecurity & Technology Controls organization, you will help deliver streamlined and consistent solutions supporting JPMorgan Chases Controls and IT Risk agendas with a focus on risk reduction, stability, security, delivery, resiliency and efficiencies. CTCs focus on standardization, consistency and simplicity fosters long-term productivity, quality and innovation across JPMorgan Chase. The disciplines within this organization are Oversight & Controls Technology, Cloud Controls, Resiliency, Security, Identity & Access Management, IT Risk & Controls, and Third Party Risk Management.We are currently seeking a Technical Analyst to join our Next Generation Engineering Identity Governance team. This person will need broad exposure to multiple technologies to assemble the right solution to a challenging problem. Integration projects are complex and involve collaboration from multiple teams, on different time schedules.We are a progressive development team within the firm working on technology at a scale that is seldom found elsewhere in the world. We use agile methodologies in our development practices and believe that great software is developed through ongoing thoughtful conversation as opposed to a big upfront design. We are building a technically diverse ecosystem using a mixture of Vendor Products, Custom In house built solutions, Graph DBs, Relational DBs, NoSQL DBs, and combining it all through a managed services layer. Were looking for true technologists who are driven by the desire to learn and push the boundaries of technology.Responsibilities:This will require an understanding of requirements, operating models, business flows and data and then partnering with technical specialists to deliver appropriate solutions. There is an implicit ownership and accountability for the solution working as intended.The ideal candidate is a results-oriented hands-on leader who can handle many different roles such as:Scrum leaderUser Centric DesignPartnering with key stakeholders to identify the solutions that meet their needsDefining user stories and acceptance criteriaMaintaining product backlogAdvising stakeholders on options, risks, and aligning of prioritiesObtaining stakeholder signoffCollaborate cross functionality with infrastructure, support, and other software engineering teamsCreating user help for end users and internal support teamsPerforming card (user story) sign-offProviding direction for testing of new functionalityFacilitating implementation of new functionality through training and demonstrationsCollaborating with business users and technology partners at all levelsBachelor's degree in Information Science / Information Technology, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, or a related field5+ years of technical Business Analysis experience within a SDLC; Agile team experience preferredFunctionally decompose complex problems into simple, straightforward solutions and ability to present recommended solutions to all levels of the organizationExperience with service-oriented architecture and web servicesAbility to lead in a matrixed organizational structureDemonstrated self-starter with good judgment and resourcefulnessExperience performing detailed data analysis, including ability to create, run, and modify SQL queriesInterest in information security and knowledge of Identity and Access Management controlsYour expertise in cyber, combined with your desire to provide innovative security services, will be an asset to our Cybersecurity and Technology Controls (CTC) organization. Help deliver high-quality security solutions across all our lines of business around the world by creating, designing, implementing, and maintaining next-level technology. The work youll do is vital, as it will protect over $18 trillion of assets under custody and $393 billion in deposits every day. As part of JPMorgan Chase & Co.s global team of technologists and innovators, your work will have a massive impact, both on us as a company, as well as our clients and our business partners around the world.When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co., youre not just working at a global financial institution. Youre an integral part of one of the worlds biggest tech companies. In 14 technology hubs worldwide, our team of 40,000+ technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $9.5B+ annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that will not only transform the financial services industry, but also change the world.At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of every employee, and were building a technology organization that thrives on diversity. We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation. If youre looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you.

Name: Digital Product Marketing Analyst
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co.:Commercial Banking (CB) provides a full range of services including lending, treasury services, investment banking, commercial card and asset management products to meet its clients’ domestic and international financial needs. CB’s 1,500 bankers serve approximately 19,000 clients nationally, including corporations, municipalities, financial institutions and not-for-profit entities, with annual revenue generally ranging from $20 million to $2 billion, and nearly 37,000 real estate clients, owners and investors. CB is the third largest commercial bank in the U.S., with almost $170 billion in loans and almost $180 billion in deposits. In 2015, CB generated revenue and earnings of $6.9 billion and $2.2 billion, respectively.Commercial Banking is undertaking an aggressive digital transformation agenda, which builds on the success of the current mobile and online service offerings. We are investing in innovative ways to deepen customer engagement and profitability through the use of digital channels. The ambitions is to position Chase as the undisputed leader in digital financial services and payments to enable Chase to deliver the highly personalized, real time experiences that customers increasingly expect. Digital Product Marketing Analyst:Commercial Bank Digital Solutions Team represents clients of the Commercial Bank on Digital related initiatives across JPMorgan Chase. The group is tasked with reviewing budget, scope, and client impact on these initiatives. The Digital Product Marketing Analyst will be responsible for supporting communications, marketing, research and training as related to Commercial Bank Digital projects and products to both internal employees and external client audiences. Primary focus will be on Chase Connect with the candidate responsible for client communications, producing client facing marketing and service materials such as quick start guides and videos, maintain intranet web sites, and creating related presentations/trainings. Chase Connect is the cash management product widely used by Commercial Bank Middle Market clients offering information reporting, account transfer, ACH, wire and remote deposit capabilities.Specific responsibilities include:Write and coordinate review and distribution of internal and external communications for the Commercial Bank Digital Solutions Team, including 1) Notices for planned events, including client newsletters, internal communications, secure messages, etc.; 2) Notices for unplanned events, such as production issues, outages, or other events with significant client impact.Participate in the digital project life cycle for communications related products including, writing business requirements/stories, testing, assisting with production ticket research/escalations, and keeping documentation up to date.Manage product intranet pages, ensuring that all documentation is kept up-to-date.Design and execute marketing campaigns, including detailed campaign reporting working with product managers and other stakeholders.Create, edit and manage marketing materials, including quick start guides, marketing sheets, videos, newsletters, and other campaign-related materials.Create target lists for marketing campaigns, usability sessions, and communication distribution.Partner with all members of the Commercial Bank Digital Solutions Team and other teams, such as Commercial Bank Change Readiness, Commercial Bank Marketing, Commercial Bank Training, Commercial Bank Product, Digital/technology, special projects teams and stakeholders (including legal, compliance and other lines of business).Create and update internal training materials (in-person and computer-based training).Provide/edit content for Chase Connect public website.Coordinate and test updates to the Chase Connect Interactive Demo. Create and maintain a demo script for sale and additional demos as needed.Create, manage and analyze internal research (i.e., call monitoring, CSP survey, etc)Analyze public and private site usage, enrollments, and user behavior trends and statistics for management reporting and recommendations.Consultation and recommendations for UI design issues including reviews for content, consistency, clarity, and usability.Experience managing the design, printing and distribution of marketing collateral, including USPS mailing guidelines and working with print vendors.QualificationsBA/BS in Communications, Marketing or a related discipline.Minimum 3-5 years of relevant experience in the Digital services industry with additional experience in several of the following areas: web design, client document production, business to business marketing.Banking, treasury, and cash management knowledge preferred, but not required.Excellent leadership skills across multiple functional areas, including Product, Operations, Sales, Marketing and across at senior management levels.Exceptional analytic, written, presentation and oral communication skills.Demonstrated passion for innovation.Ability to lead and motivate cross-functional and cross LOB teams and interact with all management levels.Capable of working in a dynamic environment, handling multiple projects under tight deadlines, and able to respond to issues quickly and creatively.Ability to navigate a large and complex organization.Experience and proficiency with Microsoft programs (Word, Excel, Powerpoint) and Adobe programs (InDesign, Acrobat). Experience with Confirmit survey tools, WebEx, Tableau, Adobe Insight, and/or JIRA is also desired (but not required).All candidates will be expected to provide samples of marketing and communications collateral that they have developed and/or worked on, and will be expected to prepare a marketing plan for both internal/external audiences for review with the hiring manager during the interview.
